original: sems can @54b gyi rigs drug cu rtsa bzhi po de dag ni sems can gyi rigs bye brag kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag tu rung ba rnams dang / de dag nyid la 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par byang ba kho na la 'jug pa'i bye brag rnam pa gsum las brtsams te gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can @54b gyi rigs drug cu rtsa bzhi po de dag ni sems can gyi rigs bye brag kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag tu rung ba rnams dang / de dag nyid la 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par byang ba kho na la 'jug pa'i bye brag rnam pa gsum las brtsams te gzhag par bya'o //
translated: These sixty-four types of sentient beings are to be understood as threefold: those who are suitable for the thoroughly afflicted and the completely purified types of sentient beings, those who are engaged in those very , and those who are engaged in the completely purified type of sentient being alone.

original: de la dang po'i 'gro ba dang ; rigs rnam par gzhag pa dang / sems can du rnam par brtags pa dang / las kyi bye brag las rnam par gzhag ba ste /
analyzed: de la dang po'i 'gro ba dang ; rigs rnam par gzhag pa dang / sems can du rnam par brtags pa dang / las kyi bye brag las rnam par gzhag ba ste /
translated: The first of these is presented in terms of five topics: the destinies, the types of sentient beings, the designations of sentient beings, the presentation of the different types of karma, and the presentation of the different types of birth.

original: tshig lnga dang / bzhi dang / gsum dang / gsum ste bco lngas bstan to //
analyzed: tshig lnga dang / bzhi dang / gsum dang / gsum ste bco lngas bstan to //
translated: These are presented in fifteen topics: five, four, three, and three topics, respectively.

original: gnyis pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba de dag nyid kyi gzhi dang / bya ba yang dag par blangs pa /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba de dag nyid kyi gzhi dang / bya ba yang dag par blangs pa /
translated: The second is presented in terms of the bases of the thoroughly afflicted and the completely purified types of sentient beings, the performance of the correct assumption of the moral discipline,

original: 'bras bu dang / bsdu ba bstan pa'i bye brag las rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang / bsdu ba bstan pa'i bye brag las rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: the result of that, and the presentation of the different types of summary.

original: tshig gnyis dang / gnyis dang / gsum dang / gnyis dang / gsum dang / bcu gnyis kyis bstan to //
analyzed: tshig gnyis dang / gnyis dang / gsum dang / gnyis dang / gsum dang / bcu gnyis kyis bstan to //
translated: The first is taught by two verses, the second by two, the third by three, the fourth by two, the fifth by three, and the sixth by twelve.

original: gsum ba ni sdom pa'i bye brag las rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: gsum ba ni sdom pa'i bye brag las rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The third is established from the different kinds of vows.

original: sdom pa rnam pa brgyad kyi phyir ni tshig bdun gyis bstan to //
analyzed: sdom pa rnam pa brgyad kyi phyir ni tshig bdun gyis bstan to //
translated: The seven verses are for the eight kinds of vows.

original: lhag ma rnams kyis ni sdom pa can mchog gi rab tu dbye ba ston to //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis ni sdom pa can mchog gi rab tu dbye ba ston to //
translated: The remaining verses teach the classification of the best of those who have vows.

original: de yang bye brag rnam pa lnga'i phyir te /
analyzed: de yang bye brag rnam pa lnga'i phyir te /
translated: That is also from five kinds of distinctions:

original: dge ba'i phyogs kyi bye brag dang / 'dug par bya ba'i yul gyi bye brag dang / bstan pa la gnod pa dang / phan pa'i bye brag dang / lung dang rtogs pa'i bye brag dang / mi'i lus thob nas 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa mchog brnyes pa'i bye brag las rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs kyi bye brag dang / 'dug par bya ba'i yul gyi bye brag dang / bstan pa la gnod pa dang / phan pa'i bye brag dang / lung dang rtogs pa'i bye brag dang / mi'i lus thob nas 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa mchog brnyes pa'i bye brag las rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: the distinction of the side of virtue, the distinction of the place of residence, the distinction of the harm and benefit of the teaching, the distinction of scripture and realization, and the distinction of attaining the supreme mundane and supramundane perfections after attaining a human body.

original: tshig gsum dang / dgu dang / drug dang / bcu dang / gnyis te sum cus bstan to //
analyzed: tshig gsum dang / dgu dang / drug dang / bcu dang / gnyis te sum cus bstan to //
translated: These are taught by three verses, nine, six, ten, and two, for a total of thirty verses.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The phrase those who are arrogant refers to those who possess the three types of arrogance that were described earlier.

original: spyir na don dam pa thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ma rtogs par rtogs so snyam du khas 'che ba'o //
analyzed: spyir na don dam pa thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ma rtogs par rtogs so snyam du khas 'che ba'o //
translated: In general, they are those who have not realized the characteristic of the ultimate, which is that all entities are of one taste, but who claim that they have realized it.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis mngon du zin cing zhes bya ba ni gcig tu de'i dbang du song ba'o //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis mngon du zin cing zhes bya ba ni gcig tu de'i dbang du song ba'o //
translated: The phrase who are dominated by arrogance means that they are completely under its influence.

original: shes pa brda sprod par zhes bya ba ni rang gis rtogs pa'i shes pa gzhan la go bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa brda sprod par zhes bya ba ni rang gis rtogs pa'i shes pa gzhan la go bar byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase who are teachers of knowledge means that they are those who cause others to understand the knowledge that they themselves have realized.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma las bzlog pa'o //
translated: The phrase who are not arrogant means that they are the opposite of the former.

original: nyung shas shig shes par 'tshal lags kyi zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi rigs drug cu rtsa bzhi las de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' la @55a * //üîΩsogs pa nyi tsher zad do zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: nyung shas shig shes par 'tshal lags kyi zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi rigs drug cu rtsa bzhi las de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' la @55a * //üîΩsogs pa nyi tsher zad do zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: The phrase I wish to know a little means that they think, The TathƒÅgata, the bodhisattvas, and so on are only a small portion of the sixty-four types of sentient beings.

original: tshad ma mchis grangs ma mchis brjod du ma mchis pa ji snyed cig mchis par 'tshal lags te zhes bya bar ni sems can gyi rigs de dag las gzhan thams cad de lta bu yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa ste /
analyzed: tshad ma mchis grangs ma mchis brjod du ma mchis pa ji snyed cig mchis par 'tshal lags te zhes bya bar ni sems can gyi rigs de dag las gzhan thams cad de lta bu yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa ste /
translated: The phrase I know that there are that many sentient beings means that all sentient beings other than those are like that.

original: de ni re zhig de dag mang ba spyir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni re zhig de dag mang ba spyir bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is a general statement about the great number of sentient beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag dus gcig cig na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de ltar mang ba de yang kha cig rang gi mngon sum du gyur pa'i sgo nas gzhan la yang rjes su dpag pa ston to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag dus gcig cig na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de ltar mang ba de yang kha cig rang gi mngon sum du gyur pa'i sgo nas gzhan la yang rjes su dpag pa ston to //
translated: The passage beginning Bhagavan, at one time shows that even though that number is great, some of them are directly perceived by oneself and the rest are inferred by others.

original: chos rnam pa sna tshogs dmigs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i ston pas zhes bya ba ni chos mtshan ma tha dad pa dmigs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ston pas zhes bya ba'i chos mtshan ma tha dad pa dmigs pas mngon par rtogs pa ston par byed pa'am /
analyzed: chos rnam pa sna tshogs dmigs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i ston pas zhes bya ba ni chos mtshan ma tha dad pa dmigs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ston pas zhes bya ba'i chos mtshan ma tha dad pa dmigs pas mngon par rtogs pa ston par byed pa'am /
translated: The phrase through the teaching of the realization of the various aspects of phenomena means that the teaching of the realization of the various aspects of phenomena is the teaching of the realization of the various aspects of the characteristics of phenomena.

original: yang na dmigs pa de nyid mngon par rtogs pa yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: yang na dmigs pa de nyid mngon par rtogs pa yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: Or else, the object is the realization of that very object.

original: phung po dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: phung po dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe aggregates as an object‚Äù is a statement of the teaching.

original: de dag ji ltar dmigs par byed pa de ni tshig 'og ma rnams kyis ston pas /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar dmigs par byed pa de ni tshig 'og ma rnams kyis ston pas /
translated: The following phrases show how they are taken as objects.

original: 'og ma rnams ni bshad pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'og ma rnams ni bshad pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The remaining phrases are equivalent to the explanation.

original: phung po'i mtshan ma dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan ma yongs su brtags pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan ma dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan ma yongs su brtags pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe signs of the aggregates as an object‚Äù refers to the specific characteristics of the aggregates.

original: phung po'i skye ba dmigs pa dang / phung po'i 'jig pa dmigs pa zhes bya ba gnyis ni spyi'i mtshan nyid dang yongs su brtags pa'i sgo nas te /
analyzed: phung po'i skye ba dmigs pa dang / phung po'i 'jig pa dmigs pa zhes bya ba gnyis ni spyi'i mtshan nyid dang yongs su brtags pa'i sgo nas te /
translated: The two phrases ‚Äúthe arising of the aggregates as an object‚Äù and ‚Äúthe destruction of the aggregates as an object‚Äù refer to the general characteristics of the aggregates and to their conceptual characteristics.

original: de gnyis ni phung po rnams kyi kun 'byung ba dang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa ston to //
analyzed: de gnyis ni phung po rnams kyi kun 'byung ba dang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa ston to //
translated: These two phrases show the aspects of the truth of origination and the truth of suffering in regard to the aggregates.

original: phung po'i 'gog pa dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa ston to //
analyzed: phung po'i 'gog pa dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa ston to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe cessation of the aggregates as an object‚Äù shows the aspect of the truth of cessation.

original: phung po'i 'gog pa mngon du bgyi ba dmigs pa zhes bya bas ni lam gyi bden pa'i rnam pa ston to //
analyzed: phung po'i 'gog pa mngon du bgyi ba dmigs pa zhes bya bas ni lam gyi bden pa'i rnam pa ston to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe realization of the cessation of the heaps‚Äù indicates the aspects of the truth of the path.

original: de ltar phung po'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / kun 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzung pa'i chos sna tshogs dmigs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ston pas don dam pa rtogs so snyam du sems shing rang gi shes pas gzhan la brda sprod par byed pa ni gzung ba'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal yin no //
analyzed: de ltar phung po'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / kun 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzung pa'i chos sna tshogs dmigs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ston pas don dam pa rtogs so snyam du sems shing rang gi shes pas gzhan la brda sprod par byed pa ni gzung ba'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal yin no //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who thinks, ‚ÄúI have realized the ultimate through the realization of the various objects that are grasped, such as the general and specific characteristics of the heaps and the aspects of origination, etc.,‚Äù and who then teaches others with his own understanding, is one who is proud of his realization of the object.

original: phung po rnams las phung po gcig gi don dam pa chos bdag med pa rab tu rtogs nas yang de las gzhan pa'i phung po so so la de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med pa yongs su tshol bar byed pa ni 'dzin pa'i mngon @55b pa'iüîΩnga rgyal gyi yin no //
analyzed: phung po rnams las phung po gcig gi don dam pa chos bdag med pa rab tu rtogs nas yang de las gzhan pa'i phung po so so la de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med pa yongs su tshol bar byed pa ni 'dzin pa'i mngon @55b pa'iüîΩnga rgyal gyi yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva who, having realized the ultimate, which is the selflessness of phenomena in one of the heaps, then seeks the ultimate, which is the suchness that is the selflessness of phenomena, in each of the other heaps, is one who is proud of his realization of the subject.

original: phung po rnams phan tshun mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin pa de bzhin du de dag gi de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med pa yang mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin par sems pa ni mtshan nyid dbye ba'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal yin te /
analyzed: phung po rnams phan tshun mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin pa de bzhin du de dag gi de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med pa yang mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin par sems pa ni mtshan nyid dbye ba'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal yin te /
translated: The pride of distinguishing characteristics is the thought that just as the aggregates have different characteristics from each other, so their reality, ultimate truth, the selflessness of phenomena, has different characteristics from them.

original: skye mched la sogs pa lhag ma rnams la yang sbyar ro ;
analyzed: skye mched la sogs pa lhag ma rnams la yang sbyar ro ;
translated: This should be applied to the remaining bases and so on.

original: / bden pa yongs su shes pa dang / spang pa dang / mngon du bgyi ba dang / sgom pa dmigs pa zhes bya ba bzhis ni bden pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang / bsgom pa'i rnam pa bstan to //
analyzed: / bden pa yongs su shes pa dang / spang pa dang / mngon du bgyi ba dang / sgom pa dmigs pa zhes bya ba bzhis ni bden pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang / bsgom pa'i rnam pa bstan to //
translated: The four lines ‚ÄúThe object of knowledge, the knower, the known, and the act of knowing‚Äù indicate the nature of the four noble truths and the aspects of their cultivation.

original: khams sna tshogs pa nyid dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni rigs la gnas pa sna tshogs la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs rnams dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa rab tu dbye ba'i tshul gyis sems can gyi spyod pa brgyad khri'i bar rnams kyi khams sna tshogs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: khams sna tshogs pa nyid dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni rigs la gnas pa sna tshogs la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs rnams dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa rab tu dbye ba'i tshul gyis sems can gyi spyod pa brgyad khri'i bar rnams kyi khams sna tshogs zhes bya ste /
translated: The object of the various constituents is the various constituents of the lineage, such as the lineages of the sravaka, pratyekabuddha, and tathagata, and the constituents of sentient beings up to the eighty-four thousand kinds of conduct, by way of the classification of attachment and so on.

original: de dag la snga ma bzhin du dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la snga ma bzhin du dmigs pa'o //
translated: They are the object of the former.

original: khams du ma dmigs zhes bya ba ni khams sna tshogs de dag la yang khams rab tu dbye bar mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: khams du ma dmigs zhes bya ba ni khams sna tshogs de dag la yang khams rab tu dbye bar mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The object of the many constituents is the various constituents, which are summarized as the four kinds of constituent classification.

original: rang bzhin du gnas pa'i khams dang / sngon goms pa las byung ba'i khams dang / rnam par dag par byar rung ba'i khams dang / rnam par dag pa byar mi rung ba'i khams yod pa lta bu dang / gzhan yang khams de dag re re la yang rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas pa ni khams gsum pa du ma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin du gnas pa'i khams dang / sngon goms pa las byung ba'i khams dang / rnam par dag par byar rung ba'i khams dang / rnam par dag pa byar mi rung ba'i khams yod pa lta bu dang / gzhan yang khams de dag re re la yang rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas pa ni khams gsum pa du ma zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, each of those elements has infinite subdivisions, called the many elements of the three realms.

original: de la dmigs pa yang snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa yang snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The object of observation of those is as was previously explained.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni lus la gtsang ba dang dngos por lta ba la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs de dag gi gnyen por lus la mi gtsang ba dang / rang bzhin med par lta ba la sogs pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag bstan pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni lus la gtsang ba dang dngos por lta ba la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs de dag gi gnyen por lus la mi gtsang ba dang / rang bzhin med par lta ba la sogs pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag bstan pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object of observation of the discordances and antidotes of the applications of mindfulness is the teaching of the applications of mindfulness that are the antidotes to the discordances such as the view of the body as clean and as a real thing, and so on, and the observation of the body as unclean and as lacking intrinsic existence, and so on.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa mthong ba zhes bya ba la bsgom pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa mthong ba zhes bya ba la bsgom pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The meditative development of the close placement of mindfulness that is the seeing is twofold:

original: 'thob pa bsgom pa dang / brten pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: 'thob pa bsgom pa dang / brten pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: the meditative development of attainment and the meditative development of reliance.

original: de la 'thob pa bsgom pa ni ma skyes pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'thob pa bsgom pa ni ma skyes pa skye ba'o //
translated: Among them, the meditative development of attainment refers to the generation of what has not previously arisen.

original: brten pa bsgom pa ni skyes pa gnas pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brten pa bsgom pa ni skyes pa gnas pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The meditative development of reliance refers to the stability of what has already arisen.

original: yang dag pa'i spong ba la sogs pa lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //üîΩmthong nas kyang bdag 'di snyam bgyi de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don dam pa thams cad du ro gcig pa'i @56a * //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i spong ba la sogs pa lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro // mthong nas kyang bdag 'di snyam bgyi de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don dam pa thams cad du ro gcig pa'i @56a * //
translated: The remaining categories, beginning with the correct exertions, should also be applied in the same way, as is appropriate.

original: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ma rtogs par rtogs so snyam du sems shing rang gi shes pa gzhan la brda sprod par byed pa de dag ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa sha stag yin no zhes bya bar dmigs kyis bstan to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ma rtogs par rtogs so snyam du sems shing rang gi shes pa gzhan la brda sprod par byed pa de dag ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa sha stag yin no zhes bya bar dmigs kyis bstan to //
translated: Having seen, one thinks, ‚ÄúI am like this‚Äù and so on. This refers to those who, without realizing the reality that is characterized by the sameness of taste everywhere, think that they have realized it and who communicate this to others. It is these who are exclusively endowed with the three types of overesteeming.

original: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gi slad du 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pas ni don dam pa thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yang dmigs kyis ston la mngon pa'i nga rgyal can mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis mngon du
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gi slad du 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pas ni don dam pa thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yang dmigs kyis ston la mngon pa'i nga rgyal can mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis mngon du
translated: The BhagavƒÅn, for the sake of this and so on, reveals the characteristic of being of one taste in all ultimate [natures], and those with manifest pride are made to abandon manifest pride.üîΩ

original: zin kyang / shes pa brda sprod par byed pa'i sems can kha cig rang gi mngon sum du gyur pa'i sgo nas gzhan yang mang bar rjes su dpag pa'i mjug bsdu ba yang ston te /
analyzed: zin kyang / shes pa brda sprod par byed pa'i sems can kha cig rang gi mngon sum du gyur pa'i sgo nas gzhan yang mang bar rjes su dpag pa'i mjug bsdu ba yang ston te /
translated: The Blessed One, the Blessed One, by saying thus and so on, reveals the characteristic of the ultimate that is of one taste in all, and also concludes the inference of others through the door of his own direct perception, even though some beings who are conceited with manifest conceit are made manifest by manifest conceit.

original: de ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is the presentation of the characteristic of manifest conceit.

original: de'i 'og tu mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnyen po'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnyen po'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: After that, the meaning of the words and so on of the presentation of the characteristic of the antidote to manifest conceit should be explained.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnyen po'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen por don dam pa thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnyen po'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen por don dam pa thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The antidote to the three kinds of manifest pride is the teaching that the ultimate has the characteristic of being the same taste everywhere.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, with reference to that teaching,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: the Lord said,

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //

analyzed: rnam par smin pas bsdus pa kun gzhi'i rnam par @61b shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the consciousness that is included in the category of karmic maturation.

original: yid ces bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ma rig pa dang / bdag tu lta ba dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / sred pa'i mtshan nyid kyi nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhi dang rtag tu ldan pa gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: yid ces bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ma rig pa dang / bdag tu lta ba dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / sred pa'i mtshan nyid kyi nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhi dang rtag tu ldan pa gang yin pa dang /
translated: The mental faculty is the afflicted mind, which is always associated with the four mental afflictions of the view of self, ignorance, the pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù and craving.

original: rnam par shes pa rnams 'gags ma thag pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams 'gags ma thag pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is also the immediately preceding cessation of the consciousnesses.

original: yang na yid ces bya ba ni gnas su gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa la bya ste /
analyzed: yang na yid ces bya ba ni gnas su gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa la bya ste /
translated: Alternatively, the mental faculty is the consciousness that is the basis for the existence of all things.

original: gnas kyang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gnas kyang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The basis for the existence of all things is of four types.

original: sa bon gyi gnas ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon gyi gnas ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The basis for the existence of seeds is the storehouse consciousness.

original: 'byung ba'i sgo 'byed pa'i gnas ni rnam par shes pa rnams 'gags ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i sgo 'byed pa'i gnas ni rnam par shes pa rnams 'gags ma thag pa'o //
translated: The basis for the existence of the opening of the door of arising is the immediately preceding cessation of the consciousnesses.

original: 'ching ba'i gnas ni nyon mongs can gyi yid de /
analyzed: 'ching ba'i gnas ni nyon mongs can gyi yid de /
translated: The basis of bondage is the afflicted mind,

original: de ma 'gags na rnam par rig pa'i 'ching ba ni grol pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma 'gags na rnam par rig pa'i 'ching ba ni grol pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if that is not stopped, the bondage of consciousness is not liberated.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gnas ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gnas ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The basis of defilement and purification is the mental consciousness,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is the basis of attachment, etc., and of faith, etc.

original: de ltar na yid ces bya ba'i sgras rnam par shes pa thams cad bsdus pa yang bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na yid ces bya ba'i sgras rnam par shes pa thams cad bsdus pa yang bstan to //
translated: Thus, the term ‚Äúmind‚Äù also indicates that all consciousnesses are included.

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po la brten nas dmigs pa rnam par rig par byed pas nye bar gnas pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag go //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po la brten nas dmigs pa rnam par rig par byed pas nye bar gnas pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag go //
translated: Consciousness is the six collections of evolving consciousnesses that are supported on the sense organs and that are present as the discernment of objects.

original: de dag gi gnas gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi gnas gang zhe na /
translated: What is their basis?

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i gnas ni gnyis te /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i gnas ni gnyis te /
translated: The basis of the store consciousness, the afflicted mind, and the mental consciousness is twofold:

original: sa bon gyi gnas ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa nyid do //üîΩde ma thag pa'i gnas ni yid do //
analyzed: sa bon gyi gnas ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa nyid do // de ma thag pa'i gnas ni yid do //
translated: The seed-state is the store-consciousness itself.üîΩThe immediately antecedent state is the mental consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i gnas ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyang yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i gnas ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyang yin te /
translated: The state of the mental consciousness is also the afflicted mind,

original: 'di ltar de ma 'gags na rnam par rig pa'i 'ching ba mi 'grol la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ma 'gags na rnam par rig pa'i 'ching ba mi 'grol la /
translated: because, when that is not stopped, the bondage of the representations is not liberated.

original: 'gags na de 'grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gags na de 'grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But when it is stopped, then it is liberated.

original: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa'i gnas ni gsum ste /
analyzed: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa'i gnas ni gsum ste /
translated: The state of the five sense consciousnesses is threefold:

original: da bang po ni lhan cig byung ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: da bang po ni lhan cig byung ba'i gnas so //
translated: The sense faculty is the co-existent state.

original: yid ni de ma thag pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: yid ni de ma thag pa'i gnas so //
translated: The mental faculty is the immediately antecedent state.

original: sa bon thams cad pa lus len par byed pa rnam par smin par bsdus pa kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni sa bon gyi gnas so //
analyzed: sa bon thams cad pa lus len par byed pa rnam par smin par bsdus pa kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni sa bon gyi gnas so //
translated: The store-consciousness, which is the seed of all things, which is included in the retribution consciousness, and which appropriates the body, is the seed-state.

original: de dag gi dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What are their objects?

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The object of the store-consciousness is twofold:

original: nang gi len pa dang / phyi rol snod yongs su ma chad pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi len pa dang / phyi rol snod yongs su ma chad pa'o //
translated: the internal appropriation and the external world, which is not limited.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi dmigs pa ni kun gzhi la bdag go snyam du dmigs pa'o //üîΩyid kyi rnam @62a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi dmigs pa ni kun gzhi la bdag go snyam du dmigs pa'o // yid kyi rnam @62a * //
translated: The afflicted mind has the store-consciousness as its object, thinking ‚Äúit is a self.‚Äù

original: par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni chos thams cad de /
analyzed: par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni chos thams cad de /
translated: The mental consciousness has all dharmas as its objects.

original: de yang rang bzhin gyi yul dang / rang dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / dus gsum dang skad cig gi rgyun gyis bsdus pa dag go //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin gyi yul dang / rang dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / dus gsum dang skad cig gi rgyun gyis bsdus pa dag go //
translated: Moreover, they are included in the objects of the specific nature, the general characteristics, the three times, and the continuity of the moment.

original: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni thams cad kyang da ltar byung ba'i dus dang / skad cig gcig gis bsdus pa rang gi mtshan nyid sha stag ste /
analyzed: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni thams cad kyang da ltar byung ba'i dus dang / skad cig gcig gis bsdus pa rang gi mtshan nyid sha stag ste /
translated: The objects of the five consciousnesses are all included in the present time and the moment of their own specific characteristics.

original: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni gzugs bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni gzugs bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The object of the visual consciousness is form that is visible and resistant.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa dag go //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa dag go //
translated: The objects of the auditory, olfactory, gustatory, and tactile consciousnesses are sound, smell, taste, and the tangible that are invisible but resistant.

original: de dag gi grogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi grogs gang zhe na /
translated: What is their companion?

original: sems las byung ba'i chos de dag dang / lhan cig 'byung zhing mtshungs par ldan pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos de dag dang / lhan cig 'byung zhing mtshungs par ldan pa rnams so //
translated: They are the mental factors and the factors that are concomitant with the mind.

original: de dag gi las gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi las gang zhe na /
translated: What is their activity?

original: mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: In brief, it is fourfold:

original: snod rnam par rig pa dang / gnas rnam par rig pa dang / bdag go snyam du rnam par rig pa dang / yul rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: snod rnam par rig pa dang / gnas rnam par rig pa dang / bdag go snyam du rnam par rig pa dang / yul rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: the perception of the receptacle world, the perception of the place, the perception of the self, and the perception of objects.

original: de la dang po gnyis ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i las yin te /
analyzed: de la dang po gnyis ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i las yin te /
translated: The first two are the activity of the store consciousness,

original: de ni rtag tu dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis pa'i phyi rol gyi snod rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa dang / nang gi len pa rnam par rig par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rtag tu dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis pa'i phyi rol gyi snod rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa dang / nang gi len pa rnam par rig par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is always the perception of the receptacle world in two ways: as unlimited external objects and as the internal appropriation of the seeds.

original: gsum pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi las yin te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi las yin te /
translated: The third is the activity of the afflicted mind,

original: de ni 'ching bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'ching bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of bondage.

original: tha ma ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug gi las yin te /
analyzed: tha ma ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug gi las yin te /
translated: The fourth is the activity of the six evolving consciousnesses,üîΩbecause they perceive the specific characteristics of the objects.

original: de dag ni dmigs pa rnam par rig par byed pas nye bar gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni dmigs pa rnam par rig par byed pas nye bar gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are present as the awareness of the object.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi las kyang rab tu dbye na yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i las ni rang dang gzhan gyi yul gyi dmigs pa rnam par rig par byed pa dang / rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam par rig par byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi las kyang rab tu dbye na yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i las ni rang dang gzhan gyi yul gyi dmigs pa rnam par rig par byed pa dang / rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam par rig par byed pa dang /
translated: The function of the evolving consciousnesses is also distinguished. The function of mental consciousness is to be aware of the objects of self and others, to be aware of the characteristics of self and others,

original: dus gsum rnam par rig par byed pa dang / skad cig gi rgyun rnam par rig par byed pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang las rnam par 'dug cing rjes su 'jug par byed pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs rnams kyi sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu yang yongs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: dus gsum rnam par rig par byed pa dang / skad cig gi rgyun rnam par rig par byed pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang las rnam par 'dug cing rjes su 'jug par byed pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs rnams kyi sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu yang yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: to be aware of the three times, to be aware of the continuity of moments, to be aware of the presence of good and bad dharmas and their functions, and to grasp the pleasant and unpleasant results of the other consciousnesses.

original: de'i rgyu las byung ba rgyu mthun pa kun nas slong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu las byung ba rgyu mthun pa kun nas slong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of their arising and is the cause of their development.

original: de dag ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs @62b gzhan dag dang thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i las yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs @62b gzhan dag dang thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i las yin no //
translated: These are the common and uncommon actions of the other groups of consciousness.

original: yang de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs rnams las thams cad kyi thams cad du khyad par du gyur pa'i las ni rnam pa bcu bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs rnams las thams cad kyi thams cad du khyad par du gyur pa'i las ni rnam pa bcu bzhi ste /
translated: The actions of the other groups of consciousness are distinguished from the above in fourteen ways:üîΩ1-3. They cause conceptualization, attention, and intoxication with regard to the object.üîΩ4. They cause madness.üîΩ5. They cause sleep.üîΩ6. They cause awakening from sleep.

original: dmigs pa la rnam par rtog pa dang / dmigs pa la nye bar sems pa dang / ra ro bar byed pa dang / smyo bar byed pa dang / gnyid log par byed pa dang / sad par byed pa dang / brgyal bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: dmigs pa la rnam par rtog pa dang / dmigs pa la nye bar sems pa dang / ra ro bar byed pa dang / smyo bar byed pa dang / gnyid log par byed pa dang / sad par byed pa dang / brgyal bar byed pa dang /
translated: 7. They cause fainting.üîΩ8. They cause recovery from fainting.üîΩ9. They cause the engagement of bodily and vocal actions.üîΩ10. They cause the degeneration of freedom from attachment.üîΩ11. They cause the uninterrupted continuity of roots of virtue.

original: brgyal ba las sangs par byed pa dang / lus dang ngag gi las 'jug par byed pa dang / 'dod chags las bral ba las yongs su nyams par byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams rgyun mi 'chad par byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam mtshams sbyor bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: brgyal ba las sangs par byed pa dang / lus dang ngag gi las 'jug par byed pa dang / 'dod chags las bral ba las yongs su nyams par byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams rgyun mi 'chad par byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam mtshams sbyor bar byed pa dang /
translated: 12. They cause the connection of roots of virtue.

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye bar byed pa'o //
translated: It causes death and rebirth.

original: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi las ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug tu blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi las ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug tu blta bar bya ste /
translated: The function of the five kinds of perceptual consciousness is to be seen in brief as sixfold:

original: rang gi yul rnam par rig par byed pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid rnam par rig par byed pa dang / da ltar gyi dus rnam par rig par byed pa dang / skad cig gcig gi rnam par rig par byed pa dang / rnam pa gnyis kyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rjes su 'jug ste /
analyzed: rang gi yul rnam par rig par byed pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid rnam par rig par byed pa dang / da ltar gyi dus rnam par rig par byed pa dang / skad cig gcig gi rnam par rig par byed pa dang / rnam pa gnyis kyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rjes su 'jug ste /
translated: it causes the perception of one‚Äôs own object, it causes the perception of one‚Äôs own mark, it causes the perception of the present time, it causes the perception of a single moment, it is engaged with the mental consciousness in two ways,

original: dge ba'i dang nyon mongs pa can gyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / las kun nas slong ba'i rjes su 'jug pa dang / sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i dang nyon mongs pa can gyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / las kun nas slong ba'i rjes su 'jug pa dang / sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: it is engaged with the wholesome and the defiled, and it is engaged with the instigation of action, and it causes the appropriation of the results of the pleasant and the unpleasant.

original: de la kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i yod pa nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i yod pa nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
translated: How should the existence and differentiation of the store-consciousness be understood?

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yod pa nyid ni rnam pa brgyad kyis khong du chud par byas la /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yod pa nyid ni rnam pa brgyad kyis khong du chud par byas la /
translated: The existence of the storehouse consciousness should be understood on the basis of eight points.

original: de'i rab tu dbye ba ni 'jug pa dang / ldog pa rnam par gzhag pas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rab tu dbye ba ni 'jug pa dang / ldog pa rnam par gzhag pas rig par bya'o //
translated: Its differentiation should be understood in terms of its engagement and withdrawal.

original: de la kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i yod pa nyid rnam pa brgyad kyis khong du chud par bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i yod pa nyid rnam pa brgyad kyis khong du chud par bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight points on the basis of which the existence of the storehouse consciousness should be understood?

original: 'di lta ste kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med na lus len pa mi srid pa dang / dang po 'jug pa mi srid pa dang / gsal bar 'jug pa mi srid pa dang / sa bon nyid mi srid pa dang / las mi srid pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med na lus len pa mi srid pa dang / dang po 'jug pa mi srid pa dang / gsal bar 'jug pa mi srid pa dang / sa bon nyid mi srid pa dang / las mi srid pa dang /
translated: They are: the impossibility of apprehending a body, the impossibility of initial engagement , the impossibility of clear engagement , the impossibility of seeds , the impossibility of karma ,

original: lus kyi tshor ba mi srid pa dang / sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mi srid pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i 'chi 'pho mi srid pas so //
analyzed: lus kyi tshor ba mi srid pa dang / sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mi srid pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i 'chi 'pho mi srid pas so //
translated: the impossibility of bodily sensation , the impossibility of the mindless samƒÅdhi , and the impossibility of the death state of consciousness.

original: de la ji ltar na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med na lus len pa mi @63a * //üîΩsrid par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med na lus len pa mi @63a * //üîΩsrid par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that without the storehouse consciousness, the apprehension of a body is impossible?

original: rgyu rnam pa lnga ste /üîΩ'di lta ste kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni /üîΩsngon las mngon par 'du byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin pas des lus len par byed kyi 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni da ltar gyi rkyen las byung ba yin pas de dag ni lus len par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa lnga ste / 'di lta ste kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni / sngon las mngon par 'du byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin pas des lus len par byed kyi 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni da ltar gyi rkyen las byung ba yin pas de dag ni lus len par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: There are five causes.

original: de ni rgyu dang po yin no //üîΩgzhan yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni lung du ma bstan pa yin pas des lus len par byed pa yin gyi 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni dge ba dang mi dge bar snang bas de dag ni lus len par byed pa ma yin te
analyzed: de ni rgyu dang po yin no // gzhan yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni lung du ma bstan pa yin pas des lus len par byed pa yin gyi 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni dge ba dang mi dge bar snang bas de dag ni lus len par byed pa ma yin te
translated: The first cause is that the foundation consciousness is the cause that arises from the formative actions of previous lives and thus it appropriates the body. The active forms of consciousness arise from present conditions and therefore they do not appropriate the body.

original: / de ni rgyu gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: / de ni rgyu gnyis pa yin no //
translated: The second cause is that the foundation consciousness is indeterminate and thus it appropriates the body. The active forms of consciousness are virtuous or nonvirtuous and therefore they do not appropriate the body.

original: gzhan yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni lung du ma bstan pa rnam par smin pas bsdus pa'i rigs yin pas des lus len par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni lung du ma bstan pa rnam par smin pas bsdus pa'i rigs yin pas des lus len par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The third cause is that the foundation consciousness is the class of karmic maturation that is indeterminate and thus it appropriates the body.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la ni lung du ma bstan pa rnam par smin pas bsdus pa'i rigs gang yin pa de ni dmigs pas /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la ni lung du ma bstan pa rnam par smin pas bsdus pa'i rigs gang yin pa de ni dmigs pas /
translated: The type of neutral consciousness subsumed by karmic maturation that exists in the six active consciousnesses is not appropriated because

original: de dag ni lus len par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni lus len par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: they do not appropriate the body.

original: de ni rgyu gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rgyu gsum pa yin no //
translated: This is the third reason.

original: gzhan yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni lus thams cad la khyab par gnas pas /
analyzed: gzhan yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni lus thams cad la khyab par gnas pas /
translated: Moreover, the foundation consciousness exists pervading the entire body.

original: des lus len par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: des lus len par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore it appropriates the body.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni gnas nges pa las so sor 'byung ste /üîΩde la rnam par shes pa gnas gang dang gang nas 'byung ba de nyid des zin par 'gyur gyi /üîΩgnas gang nas rnam par shes pa ma byung ba'i gnas de ma zin pas /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni gnas nges pa las so sor 'byung ste / de la rnam par shes pa gnas gang dang gang nas 'byung ba de nyid des zin par 'gyur gyi / gnas gang nas rnam par shes pa ma byung ba'i gnas de ma zin pas /
translated: The active consciousnesses arise individually in specific places.üîΩThe body is not appropriated by those active consciousnesses that arise from a specific place because they do not pervade the entire body.

original: da dag ni lus len par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: da dag ni lus len par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The body is not appropriated by those active consciousnesses that do not arise from a specific place because they do not exist.

original: de ni rgyu bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rgyu bzhi pa yin no //
translated: This is the fourth reason.

original: gzhan yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni dang po'i len pa'i skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis lus cig car len pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni dang po'i len pa'i skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis lus cig car len pa yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, the appropriating consciousness is the cause of the body‚Äôs simultaneous appropriation through the continuity of the first moment of appropriation.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni lan 'ga' 'byung zhing lan 'ga' mi 'byung bas gal te kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na yang dang yang du lus len pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni lan 'ga' 'byung zhing lan 'ga' mi 'byung bas gal te kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na yang dang yang du lus len pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: The active forms of consciousness sometimes occur and sometimes do not. If there were no appropriating consciousness, there would be the error that the body would be appropriated again and again.

original: de ni rgyu lnga pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rgyu lnga pa yin no //
translated: This is the fifth reason.

original: de ltar na da ltar gyi rkyen las byung ba dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba yin pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i rigs ma yin pa dang / gnas nges pa dang / yang dang yang lus len pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas kyang gal te kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med na lus len pa mi srid pas skyon du 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de ltar na da ltar gyi rkyen las byung ba dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba yin pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i rigs ma yin pa dang / gnas nges pa dang / yang dang yang lus len pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas kyang gal te kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med na lus len pa mi srid pas skyon du 'gyur bas /
translated: Thus, if there were no appropriating consciousness, there would be the error that the body would be impossible to appropriate because of being derived from present conditions, being virtuous or nonvirtuous, not being the type that is karmic maturation, having a fixed location, and having the error of appropriating the body again and again.

original: de'i phyir kun @63b gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yod par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun @63b gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yod par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that the appropriating consciousness exists.

original: ji ltar kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med na dang por 'jug par mi srid par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med na dang por 'jug par mi srid par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the foundation consciousness did not exist, it would be impossible for the first to occur.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yod na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang / lhan cig gi dngos pos 'jug cing rnam par shes pa gnyis sam gsum mam /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yod na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang / lhan cig gi dngos pos 'jug cing rnam par shes pa gnyis sam gsum mam /
translated: If the foundation consciousness existed, it would occur simultaneously with the other six consciousnesses, and two, three, or even all eight consciousnesses would occur simultaneously.

original: brgyad car lhan cig 'byung bar 'gyur ba de mi 'dod pas kun gzhi yang med la /
analyzed: brgyad car lhan cig 'byung bar 'gyur ba de mi 'dod pas kun gzhi yang med la /
translated: Since this is unacceptable, the foundation consciousness does not exist.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug kyang lhan cig mi 'byung zhing gang yang rung ba snga phyir rim gyis 'byung ngo zhes zer ba de mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug kyang lhan cig mi 'byung zhing gang yang rung ba snga phyir rim gyis 'byung ngo zhes zer ba de mi rung ste /
translated: Also, it is unacceptable to say that the six active consciousnesses do not occur simultaneously, but that one arises in sequence, either first or later.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa drug car gyi rkyen dus gcig kho nar nye bar gnas par gyur pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa drug car gyi rkyen dus gcig kho nar nye bar gnas par gyur pa'i tshe /
translated: When the conditions for all six consciousnesses are present simultaneously,

original: dang po gcig 'byung zhing gzhan yang rim gyis 'byung zhes byar rkyen tshogs par 'dra bas mi rung ste /
analyzed: dang po gcig 'byung zhing gzhan yang rim gyis 'byung zhes byar rkyen tshogs par 'dra bas mi rung ste /
translated: it is unacceptable to say that one arises first and the others later, because the assembly of conditions is the same.

original: rnam par shes pa rnams lhan cig 'byung bas na de'i phyir yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yod par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams lhan cig 'byung bas na de'i phyir yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yod par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Because consciousnesses arise together, therefore you should understand that the consciousness that is the basis of all is existent.

original: ji ltar na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med na gsal bar 'jug pa mi srid par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med na gsal bar 'jug pa mi srid par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that if the consciousness that is the basis of all does not exist, clear engagement is impossible?

original: kun gzhi med na rnam par shes pa lhan cig gi dngos pos 'jug pa yang med pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa da ltar gyi yul la gsal bar 'jug ces bya'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi med na rnam par shes pa lhan cig gi dngos pos 'jug pa yang med pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa da ltar gyi yul la gsal bar 'jug ces bya'o //
translated: If the basis of all does not exist, then because there is no simultaneous occurrence of consciousnesses, the mental consciousness is said to engage clearly in the object of the present.

original: mig la sogs pa da ltar gyi yul la gsal bar 'jug pa dang / dus gcig tu 'gyur bas mi rung ba'i rigs nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa da ltar gyi yul la gsal bar 'jug pas lhan cig gi dngos pos 'jug pa yod pas na de'i phyir yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yod par khong du chud par bya'o
analyzed: mig la sogs pa da ltar gyi yul la gsal bar 'jug pa dang / dus gcig tu 'gyur bas mi rung ba'i rigs nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa da ltar gyi yul la gsal bar 'jug pas lhan cig gi dngos pos 'jug pa yod pas na de'i phyir yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yod par khong du chud par bya'o
translated: Because it is not possible for the eye consciousness and so on to engage clearly in the object of the present and to occur at the same time, the mental consciousness engages clearly in the object of the present. Therefore, because there is simultaneous occurrence, you should understand that the consciousness that is the basis of all is existent.

original: // ji ltar na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med na sa bon nyid mi srid par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // ji ltar na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med na sa bon nyid mi srid par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that seeds are impossible if there is no store consciousness?

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi dge ba'i mjug thogs su dge ba dang mi dge ba 'byung ba la sogs pa ni gcig gi sa bon gcig yin par mi rung ba dang / sems kyi rgyun yun ring por rgyun chad pa yang 'byung ba'i rgyu med pas de dag mi 'byung ba'i rigs na 'byung ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi dge ba'i mjug thogs su dge ba dang mi dge ba 'byung ba la sogs pa ni gcig gi sa bon gcig yin par mi rung ba dang / sems kyi rgyun yun ring por rgyun chad pa yang 'byung ba'i rgyu med pas de dag mi 'byung ba'i rigs na 'byung ste /
translated: If there were no store consciousness, then it would be impossible for a single wholesome or unwholesome state to be the seed of many subsequent states, such as the arising of wholesome states immediately after an unwholesome state. Also, the stream of mind would be interrupted for a long time, and there would be no cause for its arising again. But this is not the case.

original: de'i phyir yang de dag gi sa bon kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yod par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang de dag gi sa bon kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yod par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should understand that the seeds of those states exist in the store consciousness.

original: ji ltar na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med na las mi srid par 'gyur zhe na /üîΩlas ni mdor @64a * //
analyzed: ji ltar na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med na las mi srid par 'gyur zhe na / las ni mdor @64a * //
translated: How is it that karma is impossible if there is no store consciousness?

original: bsdu na rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsdu na rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Karma is summarized as being of four types:

original: snod rnam par rig pa dang / gnas rnam par rig pa dang / bdag go snyam du rnam par rig pa dang / yul rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: snod rnam par rig pa dang / gnas rnam par rig pa dang / bdag go snyam du rnam par rig pa dang / yul rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: The first is the perception of the body, the second is the perception of the place, the third is the perception of the self, and the fourth is the perception of objects.

original: rnam par rig pa de dag kyang skad cig skad cig la cig car 'byung bar snang ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa de dag kyang skad cig skad cig la cig car 'byung bar snang ste /
translated: These perceptions occur simultaneously in each moment.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med na rnam par shes pa rnams lhan cig gi dngos pos 'byung ba med pas /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med na rnam par shes pa rnams lhan cig gi dngos pos 'byung ba med pas /
translated: If there were no ƒÅlaya consciousness, these consciousnesses would not occur simultaneously, because they would not have the same substance.

original: rnam par shes pa gcig gi skad cig la ni las shin tu tha dad pa de lta bu de dag mi rung bas mi 'byung ba'i rigs na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gcig gi skad cig la ni las shin tu tha dad pa de lta bu de dag mi rung bas mi 'byung ba'i rigs na /
translated: Since it is impossible for such different actions to occur in a single moment of consciousness, they would not occur.

original: 'byung bas rnam par shes pa lhan cig gi dngos pos 'jug pa yod pas na /üîΩde'i phyir yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yod par khong du chud par bya'o /
analyzed: 'byung bas rnam par shes pa lhan cig gi dngos pos 'jug pa yod pas na / de'i phyir yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yod par khong du chud par bya'o /
translated: But since they do occur, the ƒÅlaya consciousness must exist.

original: ji ltar na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med na lus kyi tshor ba mi srid par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med na lus kyi tshor ba mi srid par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that without the ƒÅlaya consciousness, bodily sensation is impossible?

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med na tshul bzhin nam /üîΩtshul bzhin ma yin pa sems par byed pa dang / rjes su rtog par byed pa'am sems mnyam par bzhag pa'am /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med na tshul bzhin nam / tshul bzhin ma yin pa sems par byed pa dang / rjes su rtog par byed pa'am sems mnyam par bzhag pa'am /
translated: If there were no foundation consciousness, then it would be impossible for the various kinds of feelings to arise in the body of someone who is either correctly or incorrectly contemplating, reflecting, or meditating, or whose mind is either in meditative equipoise or not in meditative equipoise.

original: sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa gang yang rung pa cig gcig gi lus la tshor ba rnam pa du ma rnam pa mang po sna tshogs gang dag 'byung ba de dag mi 'byung ba'i rigs na 'byung ste /
analyzed: sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa gang yang rung pa cig gcig gi lus la tshor ba rnam pa du ma rnam pa mang po sna tshogs gang dag 'byung ba de dag mi 'byung ba'i rigs na 'byung ste /
translated: But in fact, they do arise.

original: de'i phyir yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yod par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yod par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should understand that the foundation consciousness exists.

original: ji ltar na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med na sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mi srid par 'gyur zhe na /üîΩkun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med pa na 'du shes med pa la snyoms bar zhugs pa'am /
analyzed: ji ltar na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med na sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mi srid par 'gyur zhe na / kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med pa na 'du shes med pa la snyoms bar zhugs pa'am /
translated: How is it that the meditative attainment of nondiscernment would be impossible if there were no foundation consciousness?

original: 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i lus rnam par shes pa dang bral bas shi ba kho nar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i lus rnam par shes pa dang bral bas shi ba kho nar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If there were no foundation consciousness, then the body of someone who has entered the meditative attainment of nondiscernment or the meditative attainment of cessation would be devoid of consciousness and would be just like a dead body.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i lus ni rnam par shes pa dang bral ba ma yin no zhes gsungs pas na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i lus ni rnam par shes pa dang bral ba ma yin no zhes gsungs pas na /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn has said that the body of that being is not devoid of consciousness.

original: de'i phyir yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yod par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yod par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should understand that the foundation consciousness exists.

original: ji ltar na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med na rnam par shes pa'i 'chi 'pho mi srid par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med na rnam par shes pa'i 'chi 'pho mi srid par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that without the foundation consciousness, the consciousness at death is impossible?

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med na /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa med na /
translated: If the foundation consciousness did not exist,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni ma shi ba'i bar du rtag par 'byung ba kho nar 'dod pas /üîΩ'chi ka'i rnam par shes pas lus ro stod dam ro smad du drod yal bar byed cing spang bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni ma shi ba'i bar du rtag par 'byung ba kho nar 'dod pas / 'chi ka'i rnam par shes pas lus ro stod dam ro smad du drod yal bar byed cing spang bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: the mental consciousness would definitely arise until death.üîΩIf the mental consciousness were to abandon the body and the heat of the body were to disappear from the upper or lower body,üîΩthen the body would appear to be dead, but the body would not be dead because of the absence of the mental consciousness.

original: de ltar snang bas @64b lus len par byed pa kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa kho na dang bral bas drod yal ba dang tshor ba med par snang bar zad kyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang bral bas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar snang bas @64b lus len par byed pa kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa kho na dang bral bas drod yal ba dang tshor ba med par snang bar zad kyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang bral bas ni ma yin te /
translated: The body would appear to be dead because of the absence of the foundation consciousness, which appropriates the body, and the body would appear to be without feeling because of the absence of heat.

original: de'i phyir yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yod par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yod par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should understand that the consciousness of the storehouse-consciousness exists.

original: de la de'i 'jug pa dang ldog pa rnam par gzhag par gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de'i 'jug pa dang ldog pa rnam par gzhag par gang zhe na /
translated: What is the establishment of its engagement and disengagement?

original: mdor bsdu na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i 'jug pa ni rnam pa bzhis rnam par gzhag la /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i 'jug pa ni rnam pa bzhis rnam par gzhag la /
translated: In brief, the engagement of the consciousness of the storehouse-consciousness is established in four ways.

original: ldog pa ni rnam pa gcig gis rnam par gzhag pa rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ldog pa ni rnam pa gcig gis rnam par gzhag pa rig par bya ste /
translated: Disengagement is established in one way.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dmigs pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / gcig gi rkyen nyid gcig yin pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / lhan cig gi dngos pos 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / gcig gi rkyen nyid gcig yin pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / lhan cig gi dngos pos 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: The establishment of engagement through objective reference, the establishment of engagement through association, the establishment of engagement through the conditionality of one by one, and the establishment of engagement through the reality of simultaneity.

original: rnam pa bzhi po de dag gis ni 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po de dag gis ni 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: These four are the establishment of engagement.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ldog pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ldog pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The establishment of the disengagement of defilement should be understood.

original: de la dmigs pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dmigs pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the establishment of engagement through objective reference?

original: mdor bsdu na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis kyis 'jug ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis kyis 'jug ste /
translated: In brief, the ƒÅlaya consciousness operates on the basis of two objects.

original: nang gi len pa rnam par rig pa dang / phyi rol gyi snod rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi len pa rnam par rig pa dang / phyi rol gyi snod rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: It is the internal appropriating consciousness and the external, unlimited, world.

original: de la nang gi len pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la nang gi len pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The internal appropriating consciousness is twofold.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags dang / rten dang bcas pa'i dbang po gzugs can no //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags dang / rten dang bcas pa'i dbang po gzugs can no //
translated: It is the habitual propensities of attachment to the imagined reality and the physical sense organs with their supports.

original: de yang gzugs can gyi khams na'o //
analyzed: de yang gzugs can gyi khams na'o //
translated: The latter is in the form realm.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'i khams na ni bag chags len pa kho nar zad do //üîΩde la phyi rol gyi snod rnam pa yongs su ma chad par rnam par rig pa ni /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'i khams na ni bag chags len pa kho nar zad do // de la phyi rol gyi snod rnam pa yongs su ma chad par rnam par rig pa ni /
translated: In the formless realm, there is only the appropriating habitual propensities.üîΩThe external, unlimited, world is the object of the ƒÅlaya consciousness.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa nang gi len pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid la brten nas /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa nang gi len pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid la brten nas /
translated: On the basis of that,

original: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'jig rten dang / snod kyi rgyun bye brag tu mi 'byed par rnam par rig pa ste /
analyzed: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'jig rten dang / snod kyi rgyun bye brag tu mi 'byed par rnam par rig pa ste /
translated: It is always and uninterruptedly the world, but it is not a specific continuum of a world-receptacle.üîΩIt is consciousness.

original: 'di lta ste dper na mar me 'bar ba ni /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na mar me 'bar ba ni /
translated: For example, when a lamp is burning,

original: snying po dang / snum gyi rgyus ni nang 'jug par 'gyur la /
analyzed: snying po dang / snum gyi rgyus ni nang 'jug par 'gyur la /
translated: its wick is consumed by the inner fire

original: phyi rol du ni 'od 'byung bar byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: phyi rol du ni 'od 'byung bar byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: and light shines forth externally.

original: nang gi len pa'i dmigs pa dang / phyi rol gyi dmigs pa 'di la yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i tshul de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //üîΩdmigs pa de ni 'jig rten gyi @65a * //
analyzed: nang gi len pa'i dmigs pa dang / phyi rol gyi dmigs pa 'di la yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i tshul de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o // dmigs pa de ni 'jig rten gyi @65a * //
translated: In the same way, the mode of the foundation consciousness should be seen as the inner objective support and the outer objective support.üîΩThat objective support is subtle because it is difficult for worldly

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis kyang yongs su dpyad pa dka' ba'i phyir phra ba yin no //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis kyang yongs su dpyad pa dka' ba'i phyir phra ba yin no //
translated: experts to investigate.

original: dmigs pa de ni rtag tu yod pa yin te /üîΩlan 'ga' gzhan du 'gyur la /
analyzed: dmigs pa de ni rtag tu yod pa yin te / lan 'ga' gzhan du 'gyur la /
translated: That objective support is always present,

original: lan 'ga' gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: lan 'ga' gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin zhing /
translated: sometimes changing and sometimes not changing.

original: dang po'i len pa'i skad cig la brten nas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du rnam par rig pa ro gcig pas 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang po'i len pa'i skad cig la brten nas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du rnam par rig pa ro gcig pas 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: From the first moment of taking up a life, until the end of life, there is a single flavor of consciousness.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de ni dmigs ba la skad cig pa yin par blta bar bya ste /üîΩskad cig pa'i rgyud kyi rgyun gyis 'jug pa yin gyi /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de ni dmigs ba la skad cig pa yin par blta bar bya ste / skad cig pa'i rgyud kyi rgyun gyis 'jug pa yin gyi /
translated: The ƒÅlaya consciousness should be understood as momentary with respect to its object.

original: gcig pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: It is a continuum of moments, not a single entity.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de ni 'dod pa'i khams na ni rgyu chung ngu'i dmigs pa can du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de ni 'dod pa'i khams na ni rgyu chung ngu'i dmigs pa can du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The ƒÅlaya consciousness in the desire realm should be said to have a small object.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni rgyu chen por gyur pa'i dmigs pa can yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni rgyu chen por gyur pa'i dmigs pa can yin no //
translated: In the form realm, it has a large object.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ni rgyu tshad med pa'i dmigs pa can yin no //

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched na ni rgyu phra ba'i dmigs pa can yin no //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched na ni rgyu phra ba'i dmigs pa can yin no //

translated: In the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment, the cause is the extremely subtle objective support.üîΩThus, the consciousness of the store-consciousness is to be understood as being engaged on the basis of the objective support in two ways: as the representation of the twofold objective support, as the representation of the subtle, as the representation of the similar, as the representation of the momentary, as the representation of the objective support that is a small cause,

original: rgyu chen por gyur pa'i dmigs pa'i rnam par rig pa dang / rgyu tshad med pa'i dmigs pa'i rnam par rig pa dang / rgyu phra ba'i dmigs pa'i rnam par rig pa dang / rgyu shin tu phra ba'i dmigs pa'i rnam par rig pas kyang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dmigs pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //

translated: as the representation of the objective support that is a great cause, as the representation of the objective support that is an immeasurable cause, as the representation of the objective support that is a subtle cause, and as the representation of the objective support that is an extremely subtle cause.

original: de la mtshungs par ldan pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mtshungs par ldan pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /

original: chos de dag kyang rnam par smin par bsdus pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mkhas pa rnams kyis kyang rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir phra ba dang / gtan du dmigs @65b pa gcig la mtshungs par 'jug pa yin no //

analyzed: sems las byung ba de dag las kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa de ni /

analyzed: de nyid kyi de las gzhan pa'i sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang rnam par bshad pa yin te /

analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyun 'ba' zhig ma 'dres pa dang lhan cig 'byung zhing 'jug ste /

analyzed: de yang zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir rtogs par dka' ba yin par blta'o //
translated: It is difficult to understand because it is overwhelmed by the other consciousnesses.

original: sems can dmyal ba dag ni sdug bsngal ba dang / ji lta ba de bzhin du bsam gtan gsum po dag gi sa pa'i lha rnams la ni bde ba dang ngo //

analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar dag la ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang ngo //

analyzed: dmigs pa mi mtshungs pa la 'jug pa'i phyir te /

original: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig dang lhan cig byung yang de ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
