original: rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the presentation of the reversal of affliction.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa ldog pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa ldog pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the presentation of the reversal of affliction?

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa rnams mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa rnams mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief, the consciousnesses of the storehouse consciousness

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin te /
translated: are the root of all affliction.

original: 'di ltar 'di ni sems can gyi 'jig rten 'grub par byed pa dang / snod kyi 'jig rten 'grub par byed pa dang / da ltar gyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa 'grub par byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni sems can gyi 'jig rten 'grub par byed pa dang / snod kyi 'jig rten 'grub par byed pa dang / da ltar gyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa 'grub par byed pa dang /
translated: Thus, it is because they are the creators of the world of sentient beings, the creators of the world receptacle, the nature of the present truth of suffering, the creators of the future truth of suffering,

original: da ltar gyi kun 'byung gi bden pa 'grub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar gyi kun 'byung gi bden pa 'grub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the creators of the present truth of the origin of suffering.

original: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de ni dge ba'i chos bsgoms pas ldog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de ni dge ba'i chos bsgoms pas ldog par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the storehouse consciousness, which is the root of affliction, should be understood to be reversed through the cultivation of virtuous natures.

original: dge ba'i chos bsgoms pa de yang mthong ba'i lam la 'jug pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi sbyor ba rtogs pa dang / de'i khyad par gyi lam goms par bya ba dang / de'i mthar thug pa'i lam yid la byed pa'i gnas skabs rnams su shes par bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos bsgoms pa de yang mthong ba'i lam la 'jug pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi sbyor ba rtogs pa dang / de'i khyad par gyi lam goms par bya ba dang / de'i mthar thug pa'i lam yid la byed pa'i gnas skabs rnams su shes par bya ste /
translated: This cultivation of virtuous natures should be understood in terms of the path of insight, the path of meditative development, the special path, and the ultimate path.

original: rgyu des gnas 'gyur bar byed do //
analyzed: rgyu des gnas 'gyur bar byed do //
translated: By this cause, there is a transformation of the basis.

original: gnas su gyur ma thag tu kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa spang bar brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gnas su gyur ma thag tu kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa spang bar brjod par bya ste /
translated: Immediately after the transformation of the basis, the consciousness of the ground-of-all is to be abandoned.

original: de spangs pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyang spang bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de spangs pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyang spang bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: And because it is abandoned, all the afflictions are also to be abandoned.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de'i gnas ni gnyen por bsgyur bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de'i gnas ni gnyen por bsgyur bar rig par bya ste /
translated: The basis of the consciousness of the ground-of-all is to be transformed into its antidote.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni mi rtag pa dang / len pa dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni mi rtag pa dang / len pa dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: The consciousness of the ground-of-all is impermanent and accompanied by appropriation.

original: gnas gyur pa ni rtag pa dang / len pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas gyur pa ni rtag pa dang / len pa med pa yin no //
translated: The transformation of the basis is permanent and not accompanied by appropriation.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni gnas ngan len dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni gnas ngan len dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: The ƒÅlaya consciousness is associated with negative reflex actions.

original: gnas gyur pa ni gnas ngan len thams cad dang gtan bral ba yin no //
analyzed: gnas gyur pa ni gnas ngan len thams cad dang gtan bral ba yin no //
translated: The transformation of the support is the complete separation from all negative reflex actions.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi 'jug pa'i rgyu yin zhing /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi 'jug pa'i rgyu yin zhing /
translated: The ƒÅlaya consciousness is the causal basis for the arising of the passions.

original: lam gyi 'jug pa'i rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: lam gyi 'jug pa'i rgyu ma yin la /
translated: It is not the causal basis for the arising of the path.

original: gnas gyur pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi 'jug pa'i rgyu ma yin zhing lam gyi 'jug pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gnas gyur pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi 'jug pa'i rgyu ma yin zhing lam gyi 'jug pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The transformation of the support is not the causal basis for the arising of the passions and is the causal basis for the arising of the path.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni dge ba dang lung du bstan pa'i chos rnams la dbang mi byed la /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni dge ba dang lung du bstan pa'i chos rnams la dbang mi byed la /
translated: The ƒÅlaya consciousness does not exercise power over the wholesome and indeterminate dharmas.

original: gnas gyur pa ni dge ba dang lung du bstan pa'i chos rnams la dbang byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas gyur pa ni dge ba dang lung du bstan pa'i chos rnams la dbang byed pa yin no //
translated: The transformation of the support does exercise power over the wholesome and indeterminate dharmas.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de'i spangs pa'i mtshan nyid ni de spangs ma thag tu len pa rnam pa gnyis spong ba dang / @67b sprul pa lta bu'i lus kun du gnas pa ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de'i spangs pa'i mtshan nyid ni de spangs ma thag tu len pa rnam pa gnyis spong ba dang / @67b sprul pa lta bu'i lus kun du gnas pa ste /
translated: The characteristics of the abandonment of the ƒÅlaya consciousness are the abandonment of the two graspings as soon as it is abandoned, and the abiding in a body that is like a magical creation.

original: phyi ma la sdug bsngal yang 'byung ba'i rgyu spangs pa'i phyir phyi ma la yang 'byung bar byed pa'i len pa spong ba dang / tshe 'di la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu thams cad spangs pa'i phyir tshe 'di'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len thams cad spong ba dang /
analyzed: phyi ma la sdug bsngal yang 'byung ba'i rgyu spangs pa'i phyir phyi ma la yang 'byung bar byed pa'i len pa spong ba dang / tshe 'di la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu thams cad spangs pa'i phyir tshe 'di'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len thams cad spong ba dang /
translated: And since it is the cause of suffering in the future, it is the appropriator of future suffering.

original: gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral zhing srog gi rkyen du gyur pa tsam kun du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral zhing srog gi rkyen du gyur pa tsam kun du gnas pa yin no //
translated: And since it is the cause of all the afflictions in this life, it is the appropriator of all the negative tendencies of affliction in this life.üîΩAnd when it is destroyed, the body and life are also destroyed.

original: de yod na lus kyi mtha' ba dang / srog gi mtha' pa'i tshor ba myong bar byed do //
analyzed: de yod na lus kyi mtha' ba dang / srog gi mtha' pa'i tshor ba myong bar byed do //
translated: When it exists, one experiences the feelings that are the end of the body and the end of life.

original: de'i phyir mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, a sutra states:

original: 'di'i tshor ba thams cad de tsam gyis na yongs su gtugs par 'gyur ro zhes rgya cher ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di'i tshor ba thams cad de tsam gyis na yongs su gtugs par 'gyur ro zhes rgya cher ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: All his feelings will come to an end.

original: de ltar na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / 'jug pa dang / rtogs pa dang / goms pa dang / yid la byed pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / gnas gyur pa rnam par gzhag pas kyang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ldog pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / 'jug pa dang / rtogs pa dang / goms pa dang / yid la byed pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / gnas gyur pa rnam par gzhag pas kyang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ldog pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the afflictions of the store consciousness should be understood as eliminated by the establishment of the root of the lifecycle, by the establishment of its entry, by the establishment of its realization, by the establishment of its practice, by the establishment of its mental attention, and by the establishment of its transformation.

original: de ltar na 'di ni sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul yang dag pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul yang dag pa yin te /
translated: This is the correct method of establishing mind, thought, and consciousness.

original: de ltar khams gsum pa'i sems dang / yid dang rnam par shes pa thams cad ji skad bstan pa'i tshul 'dis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i tshul dang rnam par byang ba'i tshul thams cad khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar khams gsum pa'i sems dang / yid dang rnam par shes pa thams cad ji skad bstan pa'i tshul 'dis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i tshul dang rnam par byang ba'i tshul thams cad khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: All the afflictions and all the purities of all the minds, thoughts, and forms of consciousness in the three realms should be understood by this method as it has been taught.

original: sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshul gzhan dag yongs su bstan pa gang yin pa de ni gdul ba'i rim pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshul gzhan dag yongs su bstan pa gang yin pa de ni gdul ba'i rim pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: The other modes of mind, thought, and consciousness are taught in order to guide those who are to be trained.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: gdul ba byis pa'i shes rab can dag gi dbang du mdzad nas thabs bla bas 'jug par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa yin no //üîΩde ltar sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa de dag gi ngo bo nyid dang / gnas dang / dmigs pa dang / grogs dang / las dang / kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yod pa nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba ni 'di las phyi rol pa dag dang /
analyzed: gdul ba byis pa'i shes rab can dag gi dbang du mdzad nas thabs bla bas 'jug par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa yin no // de ltar sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa de dag gi ngo bo nyid dang / gnas dang / dmigs pa dang / grogs dang / las dang / kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yod pa nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba ni 'di las phyi rol pa dag dang /
translated: the Buddha taught the three modes of mind, thought, and consciousness in order to introduce the immature, who are to be trained and whose wisdom is weak, to the path by means of skillful methods.

original: chos 'di pa dag las kyang kha cig gis mi shes pas de dag la rang bzhin gyis lkog tu gyur pas na gsang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos 'di pa dag las kyang kha cig gis mi shes pas de dag la rang bzhin gyis lkog tu gyur pas na gsang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the nature, basis, object, companion, activity, existence, and classification of mind, thought, and consciousness are secret because they are naturally hidden from those outside this teaching and even from some Buddhists.

original: mkhas pa zhes bgyi na zhes bya ba ni chos kyi lugs shes pa /
analyzed: mkhas pa zhes bgyi na zhes bya ba ni chos kyi lugs shes pa /
translated: The word wise means those who know the Dharma.

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyis de'i spyod yul gyi gsang ba la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyis de'i spyod yul gyi gsang ba la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: He is skilled in the secrets of their domain through discerning wisdom.

original: @68a * // sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la lan gnyis su bzlas pa ni grags pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bgyi zhes bya ba ni mdo sde de dang de dag las ji skad ces gsungs na zhes bya ba'iüîΩtha tshig go //
analyzed: @68a * // sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la lan gnyis su bzlas pa ni grags pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bgyi zhes bya ba ni mdo sde de dang de dag las ji skad ces gsungs na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: As for skilled in the secrets of mind, thought, and consciousness, the repetition is for the sake of teaching the meaning of 'well-known.' As it is said means as it is stated in such and such sutras.

original: ji tsam gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa lags zhes bya ba ni chos kyi lugs shes pa ji tsam gyi sgo nas mkhas na mkhas pa lags zhes zhus pa yin te /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa lags zhes bya ba ni chos kyi lugs shes pa ji tsam gyi sgo nas mkhas na mkhas pa lags zhes zhus pa yin te /
translated: As for how much is it that the bodhisattva is skilled in the secrets of mind, thought, and consciousness? it is asking how much is it that one becomes skilled by knowing the system of Dharma.

original: chos kyi lugs shes pa zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos gnas pa nyid shes pa so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: chos kyi lugs shes pa zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos gnas pa nyid shes pa so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: As for knowing the system of Dharma, it is discerning wisdom that knows the mere abiding of dependently arisen phenomena.

original: de'i sgo nas mkhas na mkhas pa'i chos kyi lugs shes pa'i spyod yul gyi gsang ba sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / gnas dang / dmigs pa dang / grogs dang / las dang / kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i yod pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de'i sgo nas mkhas na mkhas pa'i chos kyi lugs shes pa'i spyod yul gyi gsang ba sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / gnas dang / dmigs pa dang / grogs dang / las dang / kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i yod pa nyid dang /
translated: their basis, object, companion, function, and the existence of the foundation consciousness.

original: 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa la mkhas pa de tsam gyis mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa la mkhas pa de tsam gyis mkhas pa yin no //
translated: One is skilled in the arrangement of engagement.üîΩIf the TathƒÅgata designates a bodhisattva as skilled in the secret of mind, thought, and consciousness, to what extent does he designate it?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas par 'dogs na yang ji tsam gyis 'dogs lags zhes bya bas ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ji tsam gyi sgo nas mkhas na mkhas par 'dogs paüîΩlags zhes zhus pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas par 'dogs na yang ji tsam gyis 'dogs lags zhes bya bas ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ji tsam gyi sgo nas mkhas na mkhas par 'dogs pa lags zhes zhus pa yin te /
translated: This asks to what extent one is skilled in non-conceptual wisdom if one is designated as skilled.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba ni gnas gyur pas bsdus pa yang dag par shes pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba ni gnas gyur pas bsdus pa yang dag par shes pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: Non-conceptual wisdom is supramundane right cognition included in the transformation.

original: de'i sgo nas mkhas na mkhas par 'dogs pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi gsang ba kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i ldog pa rnam par gzhag pa la mkhas na de tsam gyis mkhas par 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas mkhas na mkhas par 'dogs pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi gsang ba kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i ldog pa rnam par gzhag pa la mkhas na de tsam gyis mkhas par 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: The designation of wise in that way is the designation of wise by the extent of being wise in the presentation of the reversal of the consciousness of the ground-of-all, the secret of the domain of non-conceptual intuition.

original: yongs su zhus pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: yongs su zhus pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The meaning of the words of the question and so on have been explained.

original: // / de'i 'og tu rgya cher bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu rgya cher bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Next, the meaning of the words of the extensive explanation and so on should be explained.

original: de ni de ltar yongs su zhus nas /
analyzed: de ni de ltar yongs su zhus nas /
translated: Having asked in that way,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa rgya cher bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa rgya cher bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: the Lord's extensive explanation of the secret of mind, thought, and consciousness is that.

original: de'i phyir blo gros yangs pa khyod de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir blo gros yangs pa khyod de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, O Vast Mind, you should know it in that way and so on is stated.

original: de la rgya cher bstan pa 'dis ni sems kyi gsang ba la shin tu @68b rmongs pa gsum gyi gnyen por rgya cher bstan te /
analyzed: de la rgya cher bstan pa 'dis ni sems kyi gsang ba la shin tu @68b rmongs pa gsum gyi gnyen por rgya cher bstan te /
translated: In that regard, this extensive explanation is an extensive explanation as an antidote to the three kinds of extreme confusion about the secret of mind.

original: shin tu rmongs pa rnam pa gsum ni ngo bo nyid la shin tu rmongs pa dang / rab tu dbye ba la shin tu rmongs pa dang / brgal ba'i lan la shin tu rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rmongs pa rnam pa gsum ni ngo bo nyid la shin tu rmongs pa dang / rab tu dbye ba la shin tu rmongs pa dang / brgal ba'i lan la shin tu rmongs pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of extreme confusion are confusion about the nature, confusion about the divisions, and confusion about the answers to objections.

original: de la ngo bo nyid la shin tu rmongs pa'i gnyen por bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid la shin tu rmongs pa'i gnyen por bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching as an antidote to confusion about the nature is

original: blo gros yangs pa 'gro ba drug gi 'khor ba 'di na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa 'gro ba drug gi 'khor ba 'di na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: from ‚ÄúO Vi≈õƒÅlamati, in this cyclic existence of the six kinds of beings‚Äù up to

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'i khams ni len pa gnyis su med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'i khams ni len pa gnyis su med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: ‚Äúthe formless realm is not twofold appropriation.‚Äù

original: rab tu dbye ba la shin tu rmongs pa'i gnyen por bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba la shin tu rmongs pa'i gnyen por bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching as an antidote to confusion about the divisions is

original: blo gros yangs pa rnam par shes pa de ni len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa rnam par shes pa de ni len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: from ‚ÄúO Vi≈õƒÅlamati, that consciousness is also called the appropriating consciousness‚Äù up to

original: de tsam gyis 'dogs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: de tsam gyis 'dogs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: ‚Äúit is designated as such.‚ÄùüîΩThe teaching as an antidote to confusion about the answers to objections is

original: brgal ba'i lan la shin tu rmongs pa'i gnyen por bstan pa ni /
analyzed: brgal ba'i lan la shin tu rmongs pa'i gnyen por bstan pa ni /
translated: fromüîΩ‚ÄúO Vi≈õƒÅlamati, if the appropriating consciousness did not exist, there would be no means to establish the existence of the latent afflictions.‚Äù

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bstan to ;
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bstan to ;
translated: Then the Bhagavat, at that time, spoke these verses, and so on.

original: / de la dang por ngo bo nyid la shin tu rmongs pa'i gnyen po'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: / de la dang por ngo bo nyid la shin tu rmongs pa'i gnyen po'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Therein, first of all, the remedy for the extreme confusion about the nature is the explanation of the meaning of the words, and so on.

original: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Nature is that which is mind, mentation, and consciousness.

original: de la shin tu rmongs pa ni de dag gi mtshan nyid mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: de la shin tu rmongs pa ni de dag gi mtshan nyid mi shes pa ste /
translated: Extreme confusion about that is not knowing their characteristics.

original: de'i gnyen por kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa nang gi len par rnam pa gnyis kyis skye gnas su nying mtshams sbyor zhing 'khor bar 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa ni ngo bo nyid la shin tu rmongs pa'i gnyen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa nang gi len par rnam pa gnyis kyis skye gnas su nying mtshams sbyor zhing 'khor bar 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa ni ngo bo nyid la shin tu rmongs pa'i gnyen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The remedy for that is the teaching that the foundation consciousness is the inner appropriator, which connects to rebirth and establishes the entry into cyclic existence. This is called the remedy for extreme confusion about the nature.

original: de'i phyir blo gros yangs pa 'gro ba drug gi 'khor ba 'di na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
