translated: Again, in another sense, these four phrases teach the four kinds of meanings of the foundation consciousness.

original: 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams de la 'bras bu'i dngos por sbyor bar byed pa dang / de dag la de'i rgyu'i dngos por sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir kun gzhi zhes bya ba dang / sems can rnams de la bdag tu sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir kun gzhi zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams de la 'bras bu'i dngos por sbyor bar byed pa dang / de dag la de'i rgyu'i dngos por sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir kun gzhi zhes bya ba dang / sems can rnams de la bdag tu sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir kun gzhi zhes bya ba dang /
translated: Because sentient beings connect it to the state of being a self, it is called the foundation consciousness.

original: de dang po kho nar mer mer por zhugs pa na grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i phyir kun gzhi zhes bya ba dang / des lus zin pa'i phyir len par byed pa'i don ni kun gzhi zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de dang po kho nar mer mer por zhugs pa na grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i phyir kun gzhi zhes bya ba dang / des lus zin pa'i phyir len par byed pa'i don ni kun gzhi zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because it is the first to enter the embryonic stage, it is called the foundation consciousness because it is the single state of being both established and blissful, and because it is the appropriating consciousness because it appropriates the body.

original: go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: These are to be connected in order.

original: de ltar na tshig bzhi po de dag gis ni kun gzhi'i don gsal ba kho nar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na tshig bzhi po de dag gis ni kun gzhi'i don gsal ba kho nar bstan pa yin te /
translated: Thus, these four terms clearly teach the meaning of foundation consciousness.

original: de'i phyir kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, it is called foundation consciousness.

original: ci'i phyir sems zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sems zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called mind?

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar de ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams kyis kun du bsags pa dang nye bar bsags pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar de ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams kyis kun du bsags pa dang nye bar bsags pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúBecause it is accumulated and fully accumulated by forms, sounds, smells, tastes, textures, and mental objects.‚Äù

original: kun du bsags pa dang nye bar bsags pa zhes bya bas ni sngar gcig gi rkyen nyid gcig yin pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa'i bstan pa'i skabs su 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa yang rnam pa gnyis kyis kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyi byaüîΩba byed de /
analyzed: kun du bsags pa dang nye bar bsags pa zhes bya bas ni sngar gcig gi rkyen nyid gcig yin pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa'i bstan pa'i skabs su 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa yang rnam pa gnyis kyis kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyi bya ba byed de /
translated: ‚ÄúAccumulated and fully accumulated‚Äù indicates that the engaging consciousness also functions as a condition for the storehouse consciousness in two ways, as was explained in the context of the statement that one is a condition for the other, which presents the process of engagement.

original: tshe 'di las bon yongs su brtas par byed pa dang / phyi ma la de mngon par @72b 'grub pa'i sa bon yongs su 'dzin par byed pas so zhes smos pas bstan to //
analyzed: tshe 'di las bon yongs su brtas par byed pa dang / phyi ma la de mngon par @72b 'grub pa'i sa bon yongs su 'dzin par byed pas so zhes smos pas bstan to //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt nourishes the seeds of this life and holds the seeds for actualization in the next life‚Äù explains this.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa de dag nyid kyis bon gyis kun du bsags pa dang / de dag dmigs pa gzugs la sogs pa'i bag chags kyi nye bar bsags pa yin pas na sems zhes bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa de dag nyid kyis bon gyis kun du bsags pa dang / de dag dmigs pa gzugs la sogs pa'i bag chags kyi nye bar bsags pa yin pas na sems zhes bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: and the seeds of those operative consciousnesses are stored in it, and the latent impressions of the objective realm of form, etc. are stored in it, it is called mind.

original: de ltar na lus 'di 'dzin cing len par byed pa dang / lus 'di la grub pa dang / bde ba gcig pa'i don gyis kun du sbyor ba dang / rab tu sbyor bar byed pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i sa bon kun du bsags pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar na lus 'di 'dzin cing len par byed pa dang / lus 'di la grub pa dang / bde ba gcig pa'i don gyis kun du sbyor ba dang / rab tu sbyor bar byed pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i sa bon kun du bsags pa dang /
translated: Thus, it is the appropriator of this body, it is the appropriator of this body, it is the bond of this body, it is the application of this body, it is the storage of the seeds of form, etc.

original: nye bar bsags pa'i bag chags sogs par byed pa nyid de'i las yin te /
analyzed: nye bar bsags pa'i bag chags sogs par byed pa nyid de'i las yin te /
translated: and it is the storage of the latent impressions of the objective realm of form, etc.

original: sngar kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i las ni snod rnam par rig pa dang / gnas rnam par rig par byed pa'o zhes smos pa yang skabs 'di nyid kyis bstan te /
analyzed: sngar kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i las ni snod rnam par rig pa dang / gnas rnam par rig par byed pa'o zhes smos pa yang skabs 'di nyid kyis bstan te /
translated: The function of the store consciousness was previously stated to be the perception of the world and the perception of the place, and this present passage also explains that function.

original: de ni las kyi rab tu dbye ba la shin tu rmongs pa'i gnyen po bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni las kyi rab tu dbye ba la shin tu rmongs pa'i gnyen po bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the antidote to the confusion about the classification of the functions of the store consciousness.

original: de'i 'og tu 'jug pa'i rab tu dbye ba la shin tu rmongs pa'i gnyen po bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'jug pa'i rab tu dbye ba la shin tu rmongs pa'i gnyen po bstan pa'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Next, the meaning of the words of the explanation of the antidote to the extreme confusion about the classification of engagement should be explained.

original: de ni de ltar kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de nang gi len pa rnam pa gnyis la brten te skye gnas su nying mtshams sbyor bas /
analyzed: de ni de ltar kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de nang gi len pa rnam pa gnyis la brten te skye gnas su nying mtshams sbyor bas /
translated: Thus, that consciousness of the ground of all arises in dependence on the two internal appropriators and links with the birth site.

original: de phyin chad phyi rol gyi snod rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa rnam par rig pas 'jug pa na len pa'i rnam par shes pa de nyid la brten nas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag ji ltar 'byung zhing /
analyzed: de phyin chad phyi rol gyi snod rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa rnam par rig pas 'jug pa na len pa'i rnam par shes pa de nyid la brten nas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag ji ltar 'byung zhing /
translated: From then on, when the unsegmented external environment is engaged by the representations of consciousness, the sixfold collection of consciousness of engagement arises in dependence on that appropriating consciousness and it engages objects.

original: yul rnams la reg pa'i rim gyis 'khor bar 'jug cing mi shes pa'i gnyen por de dag gi tshul rgya cher bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yul rnams la reg pa'i rim gyis 'khor bar 'jug cing mi shes pa'i gnyen por de dag gi tshul rgya cher bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The way that occurs and the extensive teaching of the antidote to ignorance is the entry to samsara.

original: de'i phyir blo gros yangs pa len pa'i rnam par shes pa de la brten cing gnas nas rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir blo gros yangs pa len pa'i rnam par shes pa de la brten cing gnas nas rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, O you of vast intellect, the six collections of consciousness are based on and exist in dependence on the appropriating consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dag 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dag 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, O you of vast intellect, the six collections of consciousness, such as the eye consciousness, arise in dependence on and abiding in that appropriating consciousness.

original: 'dis ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa de dag gi ngo bo nyid dang / gnas dang / dmigs pa dang / grogs dang / las dang / yod pa nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba dag gis ci rigs par ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa de dag gi ngo bo nyid dang / gnas dang / dmigs pa dang / grogs dang / las dang / yod pa nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba dag gis ci rigs par ston to //
translated: This passage teaches the nature, the basis, the object, the companion, the activity, the existence, and the classification of those evolving consciousnesses.

original: de la rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i mig ces bya bas ni de dag dang mtshungs pa'i mig la sogs pa ma gtogs par mtshungs pa'i mig bstan te /üîΩdes ni mig gi @73a * //
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i mig ces bya bas ni de dag dang mtshungs pa'i mig la sogs pa ma gtogs par mtshungs pa'i mig bstan te / des ni mig gi @73a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúconsciousness and eye‚Äù indicates the eye that is similar to that consciousness, excluding the eye that is not similar to it.

original: rnam par shes pa'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i gnas bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i gnas bstan to //
translated: This shows the basis of the eye consciousness, which is simultaneous with it.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe eye that is its own prior support‚Äù indicates the eye that is the cause of the eye consciousness.

original: gzugs rnams zhes bya bas ni gzugs bstan du med la /
analyzed: gzugs rnams zhes bya bas ni gzugs bstan du med la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúvisible forms‚Äù indicates visible forms that are unimpeded and resistant.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa ma gtogs par gzugs bstan du yod la /üîΩthogs pa dang bcas pa bstan te /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa ma gtogs par gzugs bstan du yod la / thogs pa dang bcas pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúvisible forms that are impeded and resistant‚Äù indicates visible forms that are impeded and resistant.

original: des ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa bstan to //
translated: This passage indicates the object of the eye consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste zhes bya bas ni mig la brten nas gzugs so sor rig pa'i rnam par shes pa bstan te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste zhes bya bas ni mig la brten nas gzugs so sor rig pa'i rnam par shes pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe arising of eye consciousness‚Äù indicates the eye consciousness, which is the form of consciousness that arises in dependence on the eye faculty and that perceives visible forms.

original: des ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo bstan to //üîΩmig gi rnam par shes pa de dang lhan cig rjes su 'jug pa dus mtshungs pa dang / spyod yul mtshungs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo bstan to // mig gi rnam par shes pa de dang lhan cig rjes su 'jug pa dus mtshungs pa dang / spyod yul mtshungs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: This passage indicates the essential nature of the eye consciousness.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe arising of the mental consciousness that occurs simultaneously with and is in association with that eye consciousness, that has the same object as that eye consciousness, and that has the same conceptualization as that eye consciousness‚Äù indicates the mental consciousness that occurs simultaneously with the eye consciousness, that is in association with the eye consciousness, that has the same object as the eye consciousness, and that has the same conceptualization as the eye consciousness.

original: lhan cig rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: lhan cig rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat occurs simultaneously with‚Äù means that it occurs simultaneously with the eye consciousness.

original: des ni chig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa lhan cig gi dngos pos 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni chig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa lhan cig gi dngos pos 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the establishment of the engagement of the consciousness of the single moment and the conceptual mental consciousness by means of simultaneous substance.

original: dus mtshungs pa zhes bya bas ni skad cig kho na la snga phyi med par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: dus mtshungs pa zhes bya bas ni skad cig kho na la snga phyi med par 'byung ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSimultaneous time‚Äù means that they occur in the same moment, without one preceding the other.

original: des ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa gcig gi rkyen nyid gcig yin pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa bstan to ;
analyzed: des ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa gcig gi rkyen nyid gcig yin pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa bstan to ;
translated: This shows the establishment of the engagement of the eye consciousness and the conceptual mental consciousness by means of the single conditionality of the single moment.

original: / spyod yul mtshungs pa zhes bya bas ni dmigs pa'i rnam pa gcig kho na la bar du ma chod par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: / spyod yul mtshungs pa zhes bya bas ni dmigs pa'i rnam pa gcig kho na la bar du ma chod par 'byung ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSimilar object‚Äù means that they occur without interruption in regard to the same aspect of the object.

original: de sa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dmigs pas 'jug pa rnam par shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: de sa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dmigs pas 'jug pa rnam par shes pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the establishment of the engagement of the eye consciousness and the conceptual mental consciousness by means of the same object.

original: grogs dang mtshungs par ldan par 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa yang ci rigs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: grogs dang mtshungs par ldan par 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa yang ci rigs par rig par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that the presentation of the eye consciousness and so on as engaged in association with companions is also appropriate.

original: de yang mig gi rnam par shes pa de dang lhan cig 'byung zhing mtshungs par ldan pa sems las byung ba'i chos kun du 'gro ba lnga po yid la byed pa dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dag go //
analyzed: de yang mig gi rnam par shes pa de dang lhan cig 'byung zhing mtshungs par ldan pa sems las byung ba'i chos kun du 'gro ba lnga po yid la byed pa dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dag go //
translated: The five omnipresent mental factors that occur simultaneously and are associated with that eye consciousness are attention, contact, feeling, conception, and volition.

original: kun du 'gro ba lnga po de dag ni gang gi tshe mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba de'i tshe na /
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba lnga po de dag ni gang gi tshe mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba de'i tshe na /
translated: When those five omnipresent mental factors arise,

original: gdon mi za bar 'byung ba yin pas na grogs kyang yin la mtshungs par ldan pas 'jug pa yang yin te /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'byung ba yin pas na grogs kyang yin la mtshungs par ldan pas 'jug pa yang yin te /
translated: they are companions and they engage in association because they definitely occur.

original: ji ltar gdon mi za bar 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gdon mi za bar 'byung zhe na /
translated: Why are they definitely said to occur?üîΩThe BhagavƒÅn said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mig kyang yongs su ma nyams la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mig kyang yongs su ma nyams la /
translated: If the eye is not damaged,

original: gzugs @73b kyang snang bar 'gyur du zin kyang de dang 'byung ba yid la byed pa nye bar gnas par ma gyur na /
analyzed: gzugs @73b kyang snang bar 'gyur du zin kyang de dang 'byung ba yid la byed pa nye bar gnas par ma gyur na /
translated: if forms appear, and if attention that arises together with them is present,

original: de dang 'byung ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de dang 'byung ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: The eye consciousness that arises from that will not arise.

original: 'di ltar mig kyang yongs su ma nyams la gzugs kyang snang bar gyur cing de dang 'byung ba yid la byed pa yang nye bar gnas par gyur na de'i phyir de dang 'byung gi mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar mig kyang yongs su ma nyams la gzugs kyang snang bar gyur cing de dang 'byung ba yid la byed pa yang nye bar gnas par gyur na de'i phyir de dang 'byung gi mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But when the eye is not damaged, the form appears, and the attention that arises from that is present, then the eye consciousness that arises from that will arise.

original: mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
translated: The eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form.

original: gsum 'dus ba'i reg pa'o //
analyzed: gsum 'dus ba'i reg pa'o //
translated: The contact that is the coming together of the three occurs.

original: reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa'o zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa'o zhes gsungs pas /
translated: Feeling, discernment, and intention arise simultaneously with contact.

original: de'i phyir de dag mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i tshe na gdon mi za bar 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i tshe na gdon mi za bar 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, when the eye consciousness arises, they definitely occur.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir lnga kho nar nges she na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir lnga kho nar nges she na /
translated: Why are there definitely only five?

original: de dag las gang yang rung ba zhig med na yul gyi longs spyod kyi bya ba yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ni nyung ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de dag las gang yang rung ba zhig med na yul gyi longs spyod kyi bya ba yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ni nyung ba ma yin la /
translated: If any of them were missing, the experience of objects would not be complete.

original: 'dun pa dang mos pa la sogs pas gzhan dag gi yul so sor nges pa yin pas kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa'i phyir ni mang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dun pa dang mos pa la sogs pas gzhan dag gi yul so sor nges pa yin pas kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa'i phyir ni mang ba ma yin te /
translated: They are not more than five because aspiration, resolution and so on are not universal mental states since they are objects that are individually determined.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang yid la byed pa dang sems pa med na ma bsgrubs shing mngon par 'dus ma byas par rnam par shes pa mi 'byung la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang yid la byed pa dang sems pa med na ma bsgrubs shing mngon par 'dus ma byas par rnam par shes pa mi 'byung la /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn also says: If attention and intention do not exist, consciousness does not arise without being established and without being activated.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba med na yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / myong ba med par 'gyur bas rnam par shes pa 'byung ba ni don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba med na yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / myong ba med par 'gyur bas rnam par shes pa 'byung ba ni don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If discernment and feeling do not exist, consciousness would arise without apprehending the sign of an object and without experiencing it, which is meaningless.

original: reg pa med na tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dag kyang rten med pas mi 'byung ba'i phyir lnga las nyung ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: reg pa med na tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dag kyang rten med pas mi 'byung ba'i phyir lnga las nyung ba yang ma yin la /
translated: If contact does not exist, feeling, discernment and intention would not arise because they would lack a support.

original: 'dun pa ni 'dod pa'i dngos po kho na las byung gi gzhan yang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dun pa ni 'dod pa'i dngos po kho na las byung gi gzhan yang ma yin la /
translated: Intention arises only from a desired object, not from another.

original: mos pa yang nges pa'i dngos po kho na las byung zhing gzhan la ma yin te /
analyzed: mos pa yang nges pa'i dngos po kho na las byung zhing gzhan la ma yin te /
translated: Interest arises only from a determined object, not from another.

original: de dag la sogs pa gzhan yang 'khrul pa yod pas ma nges pa'i phyir lnga las mang ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa gzhan yang 'khrul pa yod pas ma nges pa'i phyir lnga las mang ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Since other mental factors such as these have error, they are not determined.

original: de'i phyir kun du 'gro ba ni lnga kho nar zad do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun du 'gro ba ni lnga kho nar zad do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore there are not more than five omnipresent mental factors.

original: kun du 'gro ba lnga po de dag ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs thams cad dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos thams cad dang lhan cig 'byung ba yin pas mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skabs 'dir yang gnas dang /
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba lnga po de dag ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs thams cad dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos thams cad dang lhan cig 'byung ba yin pas mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skabs 'dir yang gnas dang /
translated: Since these five omnipresent mental factors occur simultaneously with all aggregates of consciousness, all virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral phenomena, they should be understood to operate in the context of eye consciousness by means of the same basis,

original: dmigs pa dang / gnas pa dang / rdzas dang / dus mtshungs @74a * //üîΩpas 'jug par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang / gnas pa dang / rdzas dang / dus mtshungs @74a * //üîΩpas 'jug par rig par bya'o //
translated: object, support, substance, and time.

original: de lta mod kyi sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dbang gis dge ba'am /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dbang gis dge ba'am /
translated: However, those concomitant with the five sense consciousnesses are virtuous or nonvirtuous due to the power of mental consciousness.üîΩ

original: mi dge ba'i rgyud du 'byung bar zad kyi /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rgyud du 'byung bar zad kyi /
translated: However, those concomitant with the five sense consciousnesses arise as virtuous or nonvirtuous states due to the power of mental consciousness.

original: ngo bo nyid ni lung du ma bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni lung du ma bstan pa yin te /
translated: They are not virtuous or nonvirtuous by nature.

original: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa dag rtog pa byed pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyi lung du ma bstan pa yin pas /
analyzed: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa dag rtog pa byed pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyi lung du ma bstan pa yin pas /
translated: They are neutral by nature because the five sense consciousnesses are neutral by nature,

original: de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyang lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyang lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because phenomena concomitant with them are neutral.

original: sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan gang dag mig gi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung zhing mtshungs bar ldan pa de dag ni dmigs pa gcig la rnam pa du ma re re 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan gang dag mig gi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung zhing mtshungs bar ldan pa de dag ni dmigs pa gcig la rnam pa du ma re re 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Other mental factors that arise and are concomitant with eye consciousness are said to have many aspects on a single focal object.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: 'dun pa la sogs pa yul so sor nges pa lnga dang / dad pa la sogs pa dge ba bcu gcig dang 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa drug dang / khro ba la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mang po dag ni rnam pa du ma yod pa bzhin du de dag gi dmigs pa yang du ma yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dun pa la sogs pa yul so sor nges pa lnga dang / dad pa la sogs pa dge ba bcu gcig dang 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa drug dang / khro ba la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mang po dag ni rnam pa du ma yod pa bzhin du de dag gi dmigs pa yang du ma yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The five such as aspiration and so on are ascertained to be objects, the eleven such as faith are virtuous, the six such as attachment are afflictions and the many such as anger are branch afflictions.

original: yul drug po gang yang rung ba cig gi spyi la dmigs pas na dmigs pa can gcig pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yul drug po gang yang rung ba cig gi spyi la dmigs pas na dmigs pa can gcig pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: They are said to have a single focal object because they focus on the universal object of any of the six objects.

original: da ltar dmigs pa'i dngos po gcig yin pas dmigs par mtshungs kyang dmigs pa'i dngos po gcig la yang rnam pa du ma yod de /
analyzed: da ltar dmigs pa'i dngos po gcig yin pas dmigs par mtshungs kyang dmigs pa'i dngos po gcig la yang rnam pa du ma yod de /
translated: They are said to have many aspects because although they focus on a single present object, they have many aspects.

original: dmigs pa'i rnam pa tha dad pas de 'dzin pa'i sems las byung ba yang rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir rnam pa du ma zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rnam pa tha dad pas de 'dzin pa'i sems las byung ba yang rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir rnam pa du ma zhes gsungs so //
translated: They are said to have many aspects because the mental factors that apprehend a single object have different aspects due to the different aspects of the object.

original: dmigs pa'i rnam pa gcig la sems las byung ba yang sde tshan gcig las rdzas gcig kho nar 'byung gi / gnyis pa mi 'byung bas re re 'byung zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rnam pa gcig la sems las byung ba yang sde tshan gcig las rdzas gcig kho nar 'byung gi / gnyis pa mi 'byung bas re re 'byung zhes gsungs te /
translated: In a single aspect of an object, only one substance of a single class of mental factors occurs, not a second.

original: de dag gi tshul ni zhib tu 'og nas bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gi tshul ni zhib tu 'og nas bstan to //
translated: The way this is so will be explained in detail below.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig gi dngos po 'jug pa rnam par rtog pa yid kyi rnam par shes ba'i ngo bo nyid bstan te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig gi dngos po 'jug pa rnam par rtog pa yid kyi rnam par shes ba'i ngo bo nyid bstan te /
translated: The conceptual mental consciousness also occurs. This indicates that the conceptual mental consciousness, which is the nature of the mental consciousness that engages the object simultaneously with eye consciousness, also occurs.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Mental consciousness is of three types:

original: nye bar gnas pa las byung ba dang / tshor ba dang nges pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa las byung ba dang / tshor ba dang nges pa'o //
translated: that which arises from the foundation consciousness, that which arises from contact and that which is feeling and conception.

original: de la nye bar gnas pa las byung ba ni skad cig ma dang po la /
analyzed: de la nye bar gnas pa las byung ba ni skad cig ma dang po la /
translated: That which arises from the foundation consciousness occurs in the first moment.

original: dmigs pa nye bar gnas pa la brten nas /
analyzed: dmigs pa nye bar gnas pa la brten nas /
translated: It is the mental consciousness that arises in dependence on the foundation consciousness and its object.

original: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa yin @74b no ;
analyzed: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa yin @74b no ;
translated: The mental consciousness that arises simultaneously with the five sensory consciousnesses focuses on the intrinsic identity of its object.

original: / tshor ba ni skad cig ma gnyis pa la snga ma'i rjes su spyod pa spyi'i mtshan nyid la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: / tshor ba ni skad cig ma gnyis pa la snga ma'i rjes su spyod pa spyi'i mtshan nyid la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Feeling focuses on the general characteristics of its object in the second moment, as it experiences the object that was perceived in the preceding moment.

original: nges pa ni skad cig ma gsum pa la yul nges par gcod pa la spyi'i mtshan nyid la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: nges pa ni skad cig ma gsum pa la yul nges par gcod pa la spyi'i mtshan nyid la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Identification focuses on the general characteristics of its object in the third moment, as it determines the object.

original: skabs 'dir ni nye bar gnas pa las byung ba yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩde dag gi tshul bzhin du bshad na /
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni nye bar gnas pa las byung ba yin par rig par bya'o // de dag gi tshul bzhin du bshad na /
translated: In the present context, it should be understood that the mental consciousness is one that arises from the presence of a sense consciousness.

original: de la nye bar gnas pa las byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas pa las byung ba rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de la nye bar gnas pa las byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas pa las byung ba rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The mental consciousness that arises from the presence of a sense consciousness is a conceptual mental consciousness that arises from the presence of the condition of the sense consciousness.

original: de ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'ba' zhig la dmigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'ba' zhig la dmigs pa yin gyi /
translated: It focuses on the intrinsic identity of its object,

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid la dmigs pa ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid la dmigs pa ni ma yin no ;
translated: but it does not focus on the general characteristics of its object.

original: / rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa la yang rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du lan 'ga' ni rang gi yul gyi rang gi mtshan nyid 'ba' zhig la gnas so //
analyzed: / rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa la yang rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du lan 'ga' ni rang gi yul gyi rang gi mtshan nyid 'ba' zhig la gnas so //
translated: When the object is the intrinsic identity, the object is sometimes the intrinsic identity of its own domain, in accordance with the conditions.

original: lan 'ga' ni rang dang gzhan gnyis ka'i yul gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la dus gcig kho na dmigs par byed do //
analyzed: lan 'ga' ni rang dang gzhan gnyis ka'i yul gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la dus gcig kho na dmigs par byed do //
translated: Sometimes it is the intrinsic identity of both its own and another‚Äôs domain, and it is observed at the same time.

original: de la re zhig rang gi yul gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams sam /
analyzed: de la re zhig rang gi yul gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams sam /
translated: First, when the object is the intrinsic identity of its own domain, it is in the formless realm,

original: gzugs can gyi khams na yang /
analyzed: gzugs can gyi khams na yang /
translated: or in the form realm,

original: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi yul nye bar gnas par ma gyur pa'i gnas skabs na rang gi yul chos kyi khams bdun po dag las gang nye bar gnas par gyur pa de'i rang gi mtshan nyid yul dang / dus dang / rang bzhin gyis ma bskal bas bsdus pa gang yin pa de dang /
analyzed: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi yul nye bar gnas par ma gyur pa'i gnas skabs na rang gi yul chos kyi khams bdun po dag las gang nye bar gnas par gyur pa de'i rang gi mtshan nyid yul dang / dus dang / rang bzhin gyis ma bskal bas bsdus pa gang yin pa de dang /
translated: when the other five sense consciousnesses are not present, and the seven elements of the domain of phenomena of its own domain are present. Whatever is present, its intrinsic identity is included in its domain, time, and nature.

original: skad cig gcig la dus gcig kho nar 'byung zhing yul de la bye brag tu gcod pa ni mi byed par de'i don tsam la dmigs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: skad cig gcig la dus gcig kho nar 'byung zhing yul de la bye brag tu gcod pa ni mi byed par de'i don tsam la dmigs par byed pa ste /
translated: It occurs only at one time, in one instant, and it does not specifically discern its object, but focuses on its mere object.

original: de ni yul gyi gzugs brnyan gyi ngo bo nyid yin no //üîΩrang dang gzhan gnyis ka'i yul gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la dus gcig kho nar dmigs pa ni rang gi yul dang sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi yul rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: de ni yul gyi gzugs brnyan gyi ngo bo nyid yin no // rang dang gzhan gnyis ka'i yul gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la dus gcig kho nar dmigs pa ni rang gi yul dang sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi yul rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: It is the nature of the object‚Äôs reflection.üîΩIt focuses on the intrinsic character of its own object and the object of both itself and others at one time.

original: yul gcig gam gnyis sam /
analyzed: yul gcig gam gnyis sam /
translated: When one, two or up to five objects of its own domain and the five sense consciousnesses are present,

original: lnga char gyi bar dag las gang yang rung ba gcig gam gnyis sam /
analyzed: lnga char gyi bar dag las gang yang rung ba gcig gam gnyis sam /
translated: then one, two or up to five of them are present.

original: lnga char gyi bar dag nye bar gnas par gyur ma thag tu rang gi yul nye bar gnas pa de nyid kyi rang gi mtshan nyid la yang dmigs bzhin du sgo lnga'i yul de dag la yang /
analyzed: lnga char gyi bar dag nye bar gnas par gyur ma thag tu rang gi yul nye bar gnas pa de nyid kyi rang gi mtshan nyid la yang dmigs bzhin du sgo lnga'i yul de dag la yang /
translated: When one, two or up to five objects of its own domain are present, it focuses on the intrinsic character of its own object that is present and also focuses on those objects of the five sense consciousnesses.

original: sgo lnga'i dbang po gang gi yul gyi yul nye bar gnas par gyur pa'i dbang po gang yang rung ba gcig gam /üîΩlnga char gyi bar dang de dang 'byung ba @75a * //
analyzed: sgo lnga'i dbang po gang gi yul gyi yul nye bar gnas par gyur pa'i dbang po gang yang rung ba gcig gam / lnga char gyi bar dang de dang 'byung ba @75a * //
translated: When the object of any one of the five sense faculties is present, then either one or all five of the sense faculties arise.üîΩThe primary elements that are the basis of the sense faculties and the primary elements that are the basis of the object arise simultaneously with the object, sense faculty and consciousness.

original: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa yang gang gi yul nye bar gnas par gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yang rung ba gcig gam lnga char gyi bar gyi yul dang / dbang po dang rnam par shes pa de dag dang / skad cig dang po la dus gcig kho nar lhan cig 'byung zhing /
analyzed: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa yang gang gi yul nye bar gnas par gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yang rung ba gcig gam lnga char gyi bar gyi yul dang / dbang po dang rnam par shes pa de dag dang / skad cig dang po la dus gcig kho nar lhan cig 'byung zhing /
translated: The consciousness of the five sense doors arises simultaneously with the object, sense faculty and consciousness of any one of the five sense faculties or all five sense faculties.

original: yul de la bye brag tu gcod par ni mi byed par de'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don tsam la dmigs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: yul de la bye brag tu gcod par ni mi byed par de'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don tsam la dmigs par byed pa ste /
translated: They do not specifically discern the object, but they focus on the mere object that is the intrinsic identity of that object.

original: de yang yul gyi gzugs brnyan gyi ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang yul gyi gzugs brnyan gyi ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: That is the nature of the image of the object.

original: nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa de dang lhan cig tu 'byung ba'i sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa de dag kyang nye bar gnas pa las byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa de dang lhan cig tu 'byung ba'i sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa de dag kyang nye bar gnas pa las byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The five sensory consciousnesses that occur simultaneously with that mental consciousness that arises from the sense faculties are also called arisen from the sense faculties.

original: de dag kyang dbang po dang yul de dang 'byung ba yid la byed pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas pa las byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang dbang po dang yul de dang 'byung ba yid la byed pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas pa las byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called arisen from the sense faculties because they arise from the condition of the sense faculties, objects, primary elements, attention, and so on.

original: de dag kyang spyi'i mtshan nyid la dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang spyi'i mtshan nyid la dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: They do not focus on the general characteristics of their objects.

original: rang rang gi yul gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la bye brag tu gcod par mi byed par don tsam la dmigs par byed pa yul gyi gzugs brnyan gyi ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: rang rang gi yul gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la bye brag tu gcod par mi byed par don tsam la dmigs par byed pa yul gyi gzugs brnyan gyi ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: They focus on mere objects, the nature of which is a reflection of the object, without distinguishing the specific characteristics of their individual objects.

original: de la bye brag tu na de dag gi ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par mi rtog pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la bye brag tu na de dag gi ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par mi rtog pa nyid yin no //
translated: In that regard, they are nonconceptual by nature.

original: de la tshol ba zhes bya ba ni de ltar skad cig dang po la nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa rang gi yul gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs te skyes kyang rung sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa'i yul la dmigs
analyzed: de la tshol ba zhes bya ba ni de ltar skad cig dang po la nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa rang gi yul gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs te skyes kyang rung sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa'i yul la dmigs
translated: Seeking refers to mental consciousness that arises in the first moment from the state of nondiscernment and focuses on the intrinsic character of its own object, or it focuses on the object of the five sense consciousnesses.

original: te / sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skyes kyang rung ste /
analyzed: te / sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skyes kyang rung ste /
translated: It may arise simultaneously with the five sense consciousnesses.

original: der skyes pa'i mjug thogs kho nar skad cig gnyis pa la 'byung zhing /üîΩsngar nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas rang gi yul gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa'i yul de 'das pa de yang rung /
analyzed: der skyes pa'i mjug thogs kho nar skad cig gnyis pa la 'byung zhing / sngar nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas rang gi yul gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa'i yul de 'das pa de yang rung /
translated: It arises in the second moment immediately after it is born.üîΩThe object focused on by mental consciousness arising from the state of nondiscernment and focusing on the intrinsic character of its own object is past.

original: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi yul la dmigs pa'i yul 'das pa de yang rung ste /
analyzed: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi yul la dmigs pa'i yul 'das pa de yang rung ste /
translated: The object focused on by mental consciousness arising from the state of nondiscernment and focusing on the object of another sense consciousness is also past.

original: des yul gyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don tsam so sor rig pa'i yul 'das pa de nyid kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de mngon par gsal bar bya ba'i tshul gyis yongs su tshol bar byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: des yul gyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don tsam so sor rig pa'i yul 'das pa de nyid kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de mngon par gsal bar bya ba'i tshul gyis yongs su tshol bar byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It seeks the general characteristics of the object that has passed, the object that is the mere meaning of the intrinsic identity of the object.

original: de ni don la rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa yul gyi gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan ma la rjes su dpyod pa dang mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni don la rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa yul gyi gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan ma la rjes su dpyod pa dang mthun pa yin no //
translated: It is associated with investigation of the image of the object, with conceptualization of the object.

original: de la gang gi tshe sngar nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa des sgo lnga'i rnam par shes @75b pa gzhan gyi yul nye bar ma gyur pa'i gnas skabs na rang gi yul chos kyi khams bdun po dag las gang nye bar
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe sngar nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa des sgo lnga'i rnam par shes @75b pa gzhan gyi yul nye bar ma gyur pa'i gnas skabs na rang gi yul chos kyi khams bdun po dag las gang nye bar
translated: When the mental consciousness that arises from the prior state of mind does not encounter the object of another of the five sense consciousnesses, it is associated with investigation of the image of the object, with conceptualization of the object.

original: gnas par gyur pa de'i rang gi mtshan nyid so sor rig pa'i yul 'das pa de nyid kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de nyid kyi tshe mngon par gsal bar bya ba'i tshul gyis yongs su tshol bar byed pa de'i tshe na ni rang gi yul gyiüîΩspyi'i mtshan nyid 'ba' zhig la dmigs pa yin no //üîΩgang gi tshe sngar nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa des rang dang gzhan gyi yul rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: gnas par gyur pa de'i rang gi mtshan nyid so sor rig pa'i yul 'das pa de nyid kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de nyid kyi tshe mngon par gsal bar bya ba'i tshul gyis yongs su tshol bar byed pa de'i tshe na ni rang gi yul gyi spyi'i mtshan nyid 'ba' zhig la dmigs pa yin no // gang gi tshe sngar nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa des rang dang gzhan gyi yul rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: When the mental consciousness that arose from latent impressions seeks the general characteristics of those two objects that are the objects of the former mental consciousness that arose from latent impressions, it focuses on the general characteristics of both objects.

original: dus gcig tu nye bar gnas par gyur pa de gnyis ka'i rang gi mtshan nyid so sor rig pa'i yul 'das pa de gnyis ka'i spyi'i mtshan nyid gang dag yin pa de dag mngon par gsal bar bya ba'i tshul gyis yongs su tshol bar byed pa de'i tshe
analyzed: dus gcig tu nye bar gnas par gyur pa de gnyis ka'i rang gi mtshan nyid so sor rig pa'i yul 'das pa de gnyis ka'i spyi'i mtshan nyid gang dag yin pa de dag mngon par gsal bar bya ba'i tshul gyis yongs su tshol bar byed pa de'i tshe
translated: When the mental consciousness that arose from latent impressions seeks the general characteristics of those two objects that are the objects of the former mental consciousness that arose from latent impressions, it focuses on the general characteristics of both objects.

original: na ni rang dang gzhan gnyis ka'i spyi'i mtshan nyid la dus gcig kho nar dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: na ni rang dang gzhan gnyis ka'i spyi'i mtshan nyid la dus gcig kho nar dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And na is the observation of the general characteristics of both self and other at the same time.üîΩAscertainment is the mental consciousness that arises in the second moment and immediately after the mental consciousness that seeks in the third moment.

original: de la nges pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar skad cig gnyis pa la tshol ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa skyes pa'i mjug thogs kho nar skad cig ma gsum pa las 'byung zhing sngar tshol ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas rang gi yul gyi spyi'iüîΩmtshan nyid kyang rung /
analyzed: de la nges pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar skad cig gnyis pa la tshol ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa skyes pa'i mjug thogs kho nar skad cig ma gsum pa las 'byung zhing sngar tshol ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas rang gi yul gyi spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang rung /
translated: The mental consciousness that seeks in the second moment ascertains the object of the first moment.üîΩThe mental consciousness that seeks in the second moment ascertains the general characteristics of its own object,üîΩthe general characteristics of the object of both self and other,

original: rang dang gzhan gnyis ka'i yul gyi spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang rung ste /üîΩspyi'i mtshan nyid mngon par gsal bar byas pa'i yul 'das pa de nyid la de ni sngon po'o //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gnyis ka'i yul gyi spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang rung ste / spyi'i mtshan nyid mngon par gsal bar byas pa'i yul 'das pa de nyid la de ni sngon po'o //
translated: or the general characteristics of the object of both self and other.

original: de ni ser po'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'i 'du shes dang 'brel ba'i dran pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pas yul bye brag tu gcod pa gang yin pa de /
analyzed: de ni ser po'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'i 'du shes dang 'brel ba'i dran pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pas yul bye brag tu gcod pa gang yin pa de /
translated: The mental consciousness that ascertains the object of the first moment is the mental consciousness that is associated with the discernment that thinks, ‚ÄúThis is blue,‚Äù ‚ÄúThis is yellow,‚Äù and so on.

original: de ni don la rnam par rtog pa dang / don de'i ming la dmigs par byed pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de ni don la rnam par rtog pa dang / don de'i ming la dmigs par byed pa yang yin no //
translated: It is conceptual thought with regard to the object, and it is also the apprehension of the name of that object.

original: de rang gi yul gyi spyi'i mtshan nyid 'ba' zhig la dmigs pa dang / rang dang gzhan gnyis ka'i yul gyi spyi'i mtshan nyid la dus gcig kho nar dmigs pa'i bye brag kyang snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de rang gi yul gyi spyi'i mtshan nyid 'ba' zhig la dmigs pa dang / rang dang gzhan gnyis ka'i yul gyi spyi'i mtshan nyid la dus gcig kho nar dmigs pa'i bye brag kyang snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: It is the apprehension of the mere universal characteristic of its own object, and it is also the apprehension of the universal characteristic of the object of both itself and others at the same time. The distinctions are to be applied as appropriate, as before.

original: de ltar na gnas skabs thams cad du yang nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na gnas skabs thams cad du yang nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the mental consciousness that arises from the store consciousness and the consciousnesses of the five sense doors are the apprehension of the particular characteristic in all circumstances.

original: tshol ba pa dang nges pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnyis ni spyi'i mtshan nyid la dmigs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshol ba pa dang nges pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnyis ni spyi'i mtshan nyid la dmigs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the two mental consciousnesses that seek and ascertain are the apprehension of the universal characteristic.

original: de ltar sems gsum po de dag ni sems med @76a * //
analyzed: de ltar sems gsum po de dag ni sems med @76a * //
translated: Thus, these three kinds of consciousness are the three kinds of consciousness that apprehend the particular characteristic.

original: pa'i gnas skabs drug po gnyid log pa sems med pa'i gnas skabs dang / brgyal ba sems med pa'i gnas skabs dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings ma gtogs pa de las bzlog pa'i gnas skabs drug po dag na yid kyi rnam par shes pa rang dang gzhan gyi yul la skye ba'i gnas skabs thams cad du yang rim pa de ltar 'byung barüîΩrig par bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i gnas skabs drug po gnyid log pa sems med pa'i gnas skabs dang / brgyal ba sems med pa'i gnas skabs dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings ma gtogs pa de las bzlog pa'i gnas skabs drug po dag na yid kyi rnam par shes pa rang dang gzhan gyi yul la skye ba'i gnas skabs thams cad du yang rim pa de ltar 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the mental consciousness arises in that way in all states of engaging its own and others‚Äô objects.

original: de la sngar yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i lam ni rang dang gzhan gyi yul gyi dmigs pa rnam par rig par byed pa dang / rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam par rig par byed pa dang / dus gsum rnam par rig par byed pa dang /
analyzed: de la sngar yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i lam ni rang dang gzhan gyi yul gyi dmigs pa rnam par rig par byed pa dang / rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam par rig par byed pa dang / dus gsum rnam par rig par byed pa dang /
translated: The path of the mental consciousness is the state of knowing the objects of oneself and others, the state of knowing the general and specific characteristics, the state of knowing the three times, the state of knowing the three realms, the state of knowing the four truths, the state of knowing the two kinds of no self, the state of knowing the two kinds of purity, the state of knowing the two kinds of liberation, the state of knowing the two kinds of omniscience, and the state of knowing the two kinds of nonomniscience.

original: skad cig gi rgyun rnam par rig pa zhes smos pa la yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rang gi yul ni chos kyi khams bdun no //
analyzed: skad cig gi rgyun rnam par rig pa zhes smos pa la yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rang gi yul ni chos kyi khams bdun no //
translated: The object of the mental consciousness is the seven elements of the realm of mental objects.

original: gzhan gyi yul ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa'i yul gzugs la sogs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi yul ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa'i yul gzugs la sogs pa lnga'o //
translated: The object of the other consciousnesses is the five sense objects, such as visible form, etc.

original: de gnyi ga yang rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / dus gsum dang / skad cig gi rgyu thams cad kyis bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / dus gsum dang / skad cig gi rgyu thams cad kyis bsdus pa yin te /
translated: Both of these are included in all the causes of the specific and general characteristics and of the three times and the moment.

original: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni da ltar byung ba'i dus dang skad cig gcig gis bsdus pa dag go //
analyzed: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni da ltar byung ba'i dus dang skad cig gcig gis bsdus pa dag go //
translated: The specific characteristics are included in the present time and in one moment.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dang / skad cig snga phyi'i rgyun gyis bsdus pa dag yin te /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dang / skad cig snga phyi'i rgyun gyis bsdus pa dag yin te /
translated: The general characteristics are included in the past and future times and in the continuity of the earlier and later moments.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi yul gyi rang gi mtshan nyid da ltar byung ba'i dus dang skad cig gcig gis bsdus pa yul dang ngo bo nyid kyis ma bskal ba de dag ni nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi yul gyi rang gi mtshan nyid da ltar byung ba'i dus dang skad cig gcig gis bsdus pa yul dang ngo bo nyid kyis ma bskal ba de dag ni nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang /
translated: The specific characteristics of one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô objects that are included in the present time and one moment are not separated from the object by the nature of their own entity. They are the objects of the mental consciousness that arises from the actual basis.

original: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa yin no //
translated: They are also the objects of the five sense consciousnesses.

original: de dag gi spyi'i mtshan nyid 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus dang / skad cig snga phyi'i rgyun gyis bsdus pa yul dang ngo bo nyid kyis bskal pa dag ni 'tsho ba dang nges pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi spyi'i mtshan nyid 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus dang / skad cig snga phyi'i rgyun gyis bsdus pa yul dang ngo bo nyid kyis bskal pa dag ni 'tsho ba dang nges pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Their general characteristics that are included in the past and future times and the continuum of earlier and later moments are separated from the object by the nature of their own entity. They are the objects of the mental consciousness that is life and ascertainment.

original: de la ci'i phyir nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid la 'jug ce na /
analyzed: de la ci'i phyir nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid la 'jug ce na /
translated: Why does the mental consciousness that arises from the actual basis engage the specific characteristics?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni mngon sum gyi yul yin la /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni mngon sum gyi yul yin la /
translated: The specific characteristics are the object of direct perception.

original: de la dmigs pa nye bar gnas pa las 'byung ba'i sems de yang rtog pa med pa dang ma nor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa nye bar gnas pa las 'byung ba'i sems de yang rtog pa med pa dang ma nor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the mind that arises from the object of that is non-conceptual and non-erroneous.

original: @76b ci'i phyir tshol ba pa dang / nges pa gnyis spyi'i mtshan nyid la 'jug ce na /
analyzed: @76b ci'i phyir tshol ba pa dang / nges pa gnyis spyi'i mtshan nyid la 'jug ce na /
translated: Why are the two, investigation and ascertainment, engaged in the universal characteristic?

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin la /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin la /
translated: The universal characteristic is the object of inference.

original: de la dmigs pa'i tshol ba pa dang / nges pa'i sems de gnyis kyang rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rjes su dpog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i tshol ba pa dang / nges pa'i sems de gnyis kyang rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rjes su dpog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the two minds of investigation and ascertainment that focus on that are conceptual and inferential.

original: sngar sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa las ni rang gi yul rnam par rig par byed pa dang / da ltar gyi dus rnam par rig par byed pa dang / skad cig gcig rnam par rig par byed pa zhes smos pa ni thams cad kyang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa kho na yin pas na mngon sum gyi yul yin la /
analyzed: sngar sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa las ni rang gi yul rnam par rig par byed pa dang / da ltar gyi dus rnam par rig par byed pa dang / skad cig gcig rnam par rig par byed pa zhes smos pa ni thams cad kyang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa kho na yin pas na mngon sum gyi yul yin la /
translated: Previously, it was said that the five sense consciousnesses cognize their own objects, cognize the present time, and cognize a single moment, and since all of those are included in their own characteristics, they are objects of direct perception.

original: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa thams cad kyang nye bar gnas pa las byung ba kho na yin pas /
analyzed: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa thams cad kyang nye bar gnas pa las byung ba kho na yin pas /
translated: Also, all five sense consciousnesses arise from the mind that arises from karmic maturation alone.

original: mngon sum gyi yul la 'jug pa'i phyir de dag ni nye bar gnas pa las byung ba yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang dmigs pa mtshungs shing cha mthun pa yin pas na nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa de ni sgo
analyzed: mngon sum gyi yul la 'jug pa'i phyir de dag ni nye bar gnas pa las byung ba yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang dmigs pa mtshungs shing cha mthun pa yin pas na nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa de ni sgo
translated: Because they engage the objects of direct perception, they are similar to and compatible with the mental consciousness that arises from karmic maturation.

original: lnga'i rnam par shes pa gcig gi rkyen nye bar gyur na yang gcig dang lhan cig 'byung la /
analyzed: lnga'i rnam par shes pa gcig gi rkyen nye bar gyur na yang gcig dang lhan cig 'byung la /
translated: Therefore, when the condition of one of the five sense consciousnesses arises, it arises simultaneously with the mental consciousness that arises from karmic maturation.

original: lnga char gyi rkyen nye bar gyur na yang lnga char dang dus gcig kho nar lhan cig 'byung ste /
analyzed: lnga char gyi rkyen nye bar gyur na yang lnga char dang dus gcig kho nar lhan cig 'byung ste /
translated: When the condition of all five arises, all five arise simultaneously.

original: de'i phyir lung las /
analyzed: de'i phyir lung las /
translated: Therefore a sutra declares:

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gcig gis ni cig car du yul gcig gam /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gcig gis ni cig car du yul gcig gam /
translated: The single mental consciousness simultaneously conceives one object,

original: gnyis sam ; rab tu mang po dang / rang gi yul dang gzhan gyi yul la yang rnam par rtog par byed pas na /
analyzed: gnyis sam ; rab tu mang po dang / rang gi yul dang gzhan gyi yul la yang rnam par rtog par byed pas na /
translated: two objects, many objects, one's own realm and another's realm.

original: de'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa de'i 'jug pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa yang nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'di nyid las dgongs pa yin gyi tshol ba pa dang / nges pa gnyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa de'i 'jug pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa yang nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'di nyid las dgongs pa yin gyi tshol ba pa dang / nges pa gnyis ni ma yin te /
translated: This is stated from the perspective of this mental consciousness that arises from latent impressions, not from the perspective of the two, that which seeks and that which ascertains,

original: de gnyis ni rang gi mtshan nyid la 'jug mi srid pa dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid la yang gnas skabs tha dad par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ni rang gi mtshan nyid la 'jug mi srid pa dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid la yang gnas skabs tha dad par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible for those two to engage in their own characteristics and because they occur in different states with respect to the general characteristics of their objects.üîΩThus, this mental consciousness that arises from latent impressions simultaneously apprehends the different objects of itself and others that are included in the characteristics of their objects.

original: de ltar nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas dus gcig tu rang dang gzhan gyi yul gyi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa tha dad pa 'dzin pa 'di la ni 'gal ba yang med la /üîΩrnam par shes pa'i rdzas gcig kho nar zad pa rigs mthun pa'i sems gnyis sam /
analyzed: de ltar nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas dus gcig tu rang dang gzhan gyi yul gyi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa tha dad pa 'dzin pa 'di la ni 'gal ba yang med la / rnam par shes pa'i rdzas gcig kho nar zad pa rigs mthun pa'i sems gnyis sam /
translated: There is no contradiction in this,

original: gsum mam / mang po lhan cig byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gsum mam / mang po lhan cig byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: and it is not the case that two or three or many minds of the same type occur simultaneously as a single substance of consciousness.üîΩThis is because

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.üîΩüîΩ

original: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pas dngos po gcig @77a * //
analyzed: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pas dngos po gcig @77a * //
translated: For example, the eye consciousness apprehends one thing,

original: la rnam pa'i rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: la rnam pa'i rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: but it apprehends various aspects according to the conditions of those aspects.

original: res 'ga' ni gzugs kyi rnam par rigs gcig par sna tshogs ma yin pa gcig tu 'dzin par byed la /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni gzugs kyi rnam par rigs gcig par sna tshogs ma yin pa gcig tu 'dzin par byed la /
translated: Sometimes it apprehends one aspect of form, which is not a variety.

original: res 'ga' ni rnam pa sna tshogs du ma cig car 'dzin par byed pa la /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni rnam pa sna tshogs du ma cig car 'dzin par byed pa la /
translated: Sometimes it apprehends many aspects simultaneously.üîΩThere is no contradiction, and it is just a single substance of consciousness.

original: 'gal ba med cing rnam par shes pa'i rdzas gcig kho nar zad pas rigs mthun pa'i sems gnyis lhan cig 'byung ba yang ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba med cing rnam par shes pa'i rdzas gcig kho nar zad pas rigs mthun pa'i sems gnyis lhan cig 'byung ba yang ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Similarly, two minds of the same type do not occur simultaneously.

original: de la dang po nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i sems skyes pa'i gnas skabs na ni grogs dang de dang lhan cig 'byung zhing mtshungs par ldan pa sems las byung ba'i chos kun du 'gro ba lnga po dag kho nar zad de /

translated: In the first moment of the arising of a mind that occurs due to the presence of an object, there are only five omnipresent mental factors that are concomitant with and accompany the mind.

original: 'dun pa la sogs pa gzhan ni mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dun pa la sogs pa gzhan ni mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Other mental factors such as aspiration do not occur.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i tshe na yul la bye brag tu gcod par mi byed pas de dag gi dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe na yul la bye brag tu gcod par mi byed pas de dag gi dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, it does not specifically determine the object field because it does not have an object.üîΩIf at that time mental consciousness arising from actual meditative attainment does not specifically determine the object field, why is it called conceptual?üîΩAt that time, it is called conceptual because it is less conceptual and it is called mental consciousness because it is consciousness that is mental.üîΩIt is called mental consciousness because it is consciousness that is mental.üîΩIt is called mental consciousness because it is consciousness that is mental.

original: de'i tshe na nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa de yul bye brag tu gcod par mi byed na ci'i phyir rnam par rtog pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe na nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa de yul bye brag tu gcod par mi byed na ci'i phyir rnam par rtog pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: It is called mental consciousness because it is consciousness that is mental.üîΩIt is called mental consciousness because it is consciousness that is mental.üîΩIt is called mental consciousness because it is consciousness that is mental.üîΩIt is called mental consciousness because it is consciousness that is mental.üîΩIt is called mental consciousness because it is consciousness that is mental.

translated: It is called mental consciousness because it is consciousness that is mental.

analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dag la sogs pa ltar rang bzhin gyis rnam par mi rtog pa yang ma yin la /
translated: It is called mental consciousness because it is consciousness that is mental.üîΩIt is called

original: de ma thag tu tshol ba pa dang / nges pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyun rnam par rtog pa rags pa dang ldan pa dag kyang bskyed cing de dag gis yul gyi spyi'i mtshan nyid la rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ni rnam par rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ma thag tu tshol ba pa dang / nges pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyun rnam par rtog pa rags pa dang ldan pa dag kyang bskyed cing de dag gis yul gyi spyi'i mtshan nyid la rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ni rnam par rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Immediately after that, the continuum of the mental consciousness that seeks and ascertains generates coarse conceptualization, and because it has the nature of conceptualizing the general characteristics of objects, it is called conceptual.

original: tshol ba pa'i sems skyes pa'i gnas skabs na ni grogs kun du 'gro ba lnga po de dag nyid dang 'dun pa yang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshol ba pa'i sems skyes pa'i gnas skabs na ni grogs kun du 'gro ba lnga po de dag nyid dang 'dun pa yang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: When the mind that seeks arises, those five universal mental factors and aspiration also occur.

original: 'dun pa ni 'dod pa'i dngos po kho na las 'byung la /
analyzed: 'dun pa ni 'dod pa'i dngos po kho na las 'byung la /
translated: Aspiration arises only from a desired object.

original: tshol ba la yang nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i rnam par shes pas dmigs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid so sor rig pa'i yul 'das pa de nyid la /
analyzed: tshol ba la yang nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i rnam par shes pas dmigs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid so sor rig pa'i yul 'das pa de nyid la /
translated: When seeking, the mental consciousness that arises from the object of engagement observes the specific characteristics of the object that is the object of engagement.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid mngon par gsal bar bya ba'i tshul gyis yongs su tshol bar byed pa yin pas de nyid 'dun pa'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i skabs na mos pa la sogs pa @77b sems las byung ba'i chos lhag ma gzhan ni mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid mngon par gsal bar bya ba'i tshul gyis yongs su tshol bar byed pa yin pas de nyid 'dun pa'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro // de'i skabs na mos pa la sogs pa @77b sems las byung ba'i chos lhag ma gzhan ni mi 'byung ste /
translated: Since it is the object of aspiration, it is the focal object of aspiration.

original: de'i tshe na yul ma nges pas de dag gi dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe na yul ma nges pas de dag gi dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, other mental factors such as aspiration do not occur because their focal objects do not exist since the object is not ascertained.

original: nges pa'i sems skyes pa'i gnas skabs na ni grogs kun du 'gro ba lnga po de dag nyid dang / sems las byung ba'i chos dmigs pa gcig la rnam pa du ma re re 'byung ba de dag kyang rang rang gi dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i rkyen ji lta ba bzhin 'byung ngo //

translated: When the mind is ascertained, those five omnipresent mental factors and other mental factors that occur with a single focal object and aspect arise in accordance with the conditions of their individual focal objects and aspects.

translated: But in this context, the sutra states that conceptual mental consciousness also arises, but this should be understood as a limited statement about mental consciousness that arises from the foundation consciousness.

original: 'dir rnam par shes pa 'jug pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan pa ni mdor na lhan cig byung ba'i mig gi dbang po dang / dmigs pa gzugs dang / de dang byung ba mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / de dang lhan cig byung ba nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnams ni skad cig kho na la snga phyi med par dus gcig tu 'byung bar bzhed do //
analyzed: 'dir rnam par shes pa 'jug pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan pa ni mdor na lhan cig byung ba'i mig gi dbang po dang / dmigs pa gzugs dang / de dang byung ba mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / de dang lhan cig byung ba nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnams ni skad cig kho na la snga phyi med par dus gcig tu 'byung bar bzhed do //
translated: Here, the teaching of the classification of consciousnesses is this: in brief, the eye faculty that arises simultaneously, the form that is the object, the eye consciousness that arises from that, and the mental consciousness that arises from the eye consciousness that arises simultaneously with it arise in a single moment without priority or posteriority.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: mig gi dbang po ni mig gi rnam par shes pa lhan cig 'byung ba'i gnas yin la /

original: gzugs ni mig gi rnam par shes pa gzugs gang gi rnam pa skyes pa de nyid kyi rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa dang / de dang lhan cig 'byung ba nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa de dang lhan cig 'jug pa dus mtshungs pa /

translated: the term ‚Äúin dependence on‚Äù means that in the first moment the eye and form contact each other and in the second moment the eye consciousness arises.

analyzed: skad cig gsum pa la des drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung bas de dag ni dus tha dad do snyam na /

original: de yang cis mngon zhe na /
analyzed: de yang cis mngon zhe na /

translated: Because this arises, this arises.‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa ni 'bras bu yin pas rgyu la brten te 'bras bu 'byung ngo zhes rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul bstan pa yin gyi dngos su na de dag ni dus gcig pa yin te /

original: 'di ltar mig ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i gnas yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i gnas yin la /

original: de la 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba zhes bya ba ni sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa dus snga phyir byung ba'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rgyu ni snga la /

translated: Here, the statement ‚ÄúThis arises due to the arising of that‚Äù is made from the perspective of the earlier and later stages of the dependent origination that occurs in a sequence of earlier and later moments, such as the seed and sprout.

original: 'bras bu ni 'phyi ba rnams kyi dbang du mdzad de gsungs pa yin pas de dag la ni snga phyi yod pas rtag tu rung gi / mig dang / gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa la ni snga phyi med de /

translated: The cause is earlier and the effect is later. Therefore, they are suitable to be sequential, but the eye, form, and eye consciousness are not sequential.

original: dus gcig pa yin par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: dus dang dmigs pa tha dad ces byar yang mi rung la /

original: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa ni skad cig gcig rnam par rig @80b pa yin pas rang gi yul skad cig gcig pa nye bar gyur pa de nyid kyi rnam pa so sor rig nas yul dang bcas te 'gags pas skad cig phyi ma la yid
analyzed: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa ni skad cig gcig rnam par rig @80b pa yin pas rang gi yul skad cig gcig pa nye bar gyur pa de nyid kyi rnam pa so sor rig nas yul dang bcas te 'gags pas skad cig phyi ma la yid
