analyzed: de dag kyang skad cig gcig kho na la snga phyi med par 'byung bar rig par bya ste /
translated: Also, they should be understood to occur simultaneously, not sequentially.

original: snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: As before, they are connected as appropriate.

original: gal te mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig lan cig byung na ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang spyod yul mtshungs pa rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang gcig kho na lan cig 'byung ngo //üîΩgal te rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gnyis sam /
analyzed: gal te mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig lan cig byung na ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang spyod yul mtshungs pa rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang gcig kho na lan cig 'byung ngo // gal te rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gnyis sam /
translated: If one eye consciousness occurs once, then one conceptual mental consciousness with a similar object to the eye consciousness also occurs once.

original: gsum mam / bzhi lan cig gam lnga char lan cig byung na yang der rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag dang spyod yul mtshungs pa rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang gcig kho na lan cig 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tshar gyis ni nye bar
analyzed: gsum mam / bzhi lan cig gam lnga char lan cig byung na yang der rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag dang spyod yul mtshungs pa rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang gcig kho na lan cig 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tshar gyis ni nye bar
translated: If two, three, four, or all five collections of consciousness occur once, then one conceptual mental consciousness with a similar object to the five collections of consciousness also occurs once.üîΩThis is the general rule.

original: gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa rang dang gzhan gyi yul gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa de sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du gcig gam /
analyzed: gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa rang dang gzhan gyi yul gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa de sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du gcig gam /
translated: The mental consciousness that arises from the faculty of equipoise focuses on the intrinsic identity of objects of its own and others' realms.üîΩ

original: gnyis sam / lnga char gyi bar dang lhan cig 'byung ba nyid kyi tshul ston te /
analyzed: gnyis sam / lnga char gyi bar dang lhan cig 'byung ba nyid kyi tshul ston te /
translated: The mental consciousness that arises from the mind faculty focuses on the intrinsic characteristics of objects of its own and other levels. It occurs simultaneously with one, two, three, four, or five sense consciousnesses, depending on the conditions.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni phyi rol gyi yul gyi rkyen la rag las pa yin pas 'byung ba'i rim pa dang dus nges pa med de gang gi rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur pa nyid 'byung zhing gzhan ni mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni phyi rol gyi yul gyi rkyen la rag las pa yin pas 'byung ba'i rim pa dang dus nges pa med de gang gi rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur pa nyid 'byung zhing gzhan ni mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Since the five sense consciousnesses depend on external object-conditions, there is no fixed order or time for their occurrence. Whatever condition is present, that arises and the others do not.

original: rkyen rnams la yang nges pa med de /
analyzed: rkyen rnams la yang nges pa med de /
translated: Also, there is no fixed order for the conditions.

original: lan 'ga' ni gcig gi rkyen nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: lan 'ga' ni gcig gi rkyen nye bar gnas so //
translated: Sometimes the condition for one is present.

original: lan 'ga' ni gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi'am /
analyzed: lan 'ga' ni gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi'am /
translated: Sometimes the conditions for two, three, four or

original: lnga char gyi rkyen dus gcig tu nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lnga char gyi rkyen dus gcig tu nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: five are present simultaneously.

original: de ltar gcig gi rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na yang gang gi rkyen nye bar gnas ba de nyid kyi rnam par shes pa @81b gcig kho na rang gi rkyen la brten te 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar gcig gi rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na yang gang gi rkyen nye bar gnas ba de nyid kyi rnam par shes pa @81b gcig kho na rang gi rkyen la brten te 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, when the condition of one is present, then only the consciousness of that one arises in dependence on its own condition.

original: rkyen gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi'am lnga char dus gcig tu nye bar gnas par gyur na yang /
analyzed: rkyen gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi'am lnga char dus gcig tu nye bar gnas par gyur na yang /
translated: When the condition of two, three, four, or all five is present,

original: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa lnga char dus gcig kho nar rang rang gi rkyen la brten te 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa lnga char dus gcig kho nar rang rang gi rkyen la brten te 'byung ngo //
translated: then only the five consciousnesses of the five sense doors arise simultaneously in dependence on their own conditions.

original: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa de dag ni rang rang gi yul gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa de dag ni rang rang gi yul gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa ste /
translated: These five consciousnesses of the five sense doors have as their object the intrinsic identity of their own object.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa yang yul gyi rnam pa'i rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa yang yul gyi rnam pa'i rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: The eye consciousness, in accordance with the condition of the aspect of the object,

original: gzugs kyi dngos po gcig la yang res 'ga' ni gzugs kyi rnam par rig pa gcig ba sna tshogs ma yin pa 'dzin par byed la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi dngos po gcig la yang res 'ga' ni gzugs kyi rnam par rig pa gcig ba sna tshogs ma yin pa 'dzin par byed la /
translated: sometimes apprehends a single aspect of form in a single thing.

original: res 'ga' ni rnam pa sna tshogs du ma cig car 'dzin par byed de /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni rnam pa sna tshogs du ma cig car 'dzin par byed de /
translated: Sometimes it apprehends many different aspects simultaneously.

original: de ltar rnam pa sna tshogs du ma cig car 'dzin kyang shes pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig tu zad pas rigs mthun pa'i sems gnyis cig car 'byung ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa sna tshogs du ma cig car 'dzin kyang shes pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig tu zad pas rigs mthun pa'i sems gnyis cig car 'byung ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Even though it apprehends many different aspects simultaneously, it is still just a single nature of consciousness, so two minds of the same type do not occur simultaneously.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes ba la sogs pa lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes ba la sogs pa lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin te /
translated: The remaining consciousnesses, such as auditory consciousness, are also like this.

original: de ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i tshul bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i tshul bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the way the consciousnesses of the five sense doors arise.

original: de lta bas na nye bar gnas pa las 'byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa de yang sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa de dag gi rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du lan 'ga' ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa gcig dang gnyis dus gcig tu rkyen de
analyzed: de lta bas na nye bar gnas pa las 'byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa de yang sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa de dag gi rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du lan 'ga' ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa gcig dang gnyis dus gcig tu rkyen de
translated: Therefore, the mental consciousness that arises from the storehouse consciousness also sometimes arises simultaneously with one or two of the five sense consciousnesses, depending on the conditions,

original: nyid la brten te 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyid la brten te 'byung ngo //
translated: on the basis of the same condition.

original: lan 'ga' ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi'am lnga char gyi bar dang drug dus gcig tu rang rang gi rkyen de dag la brten te 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lan 'ga' ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi'am lnga char gyi bar dang drug dus gcig tu rang rang gi rkyen de dag la brten te 'byung ngo //
translated: Sometimes two, three, four, or even all five of the sensory consciousnesses occur simultaneously, and then all six consciousnesses occur simultaneously.

original: de de ltar dus gcig tu sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa lnga char gyi bar dang lhan cig 'byung yang /
analyzed: de de ltar dus gcig tu sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa lnga char gyi bar dang lhan cig 'byung yang /
translated: Although they occur simultaneously in this way,

original: skyes bu skar khung tha dad pa nas 'jug pa dag bzhin du rdzas tha dad pa yang ma yin te shes pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig tu zad par rigs mthun pa'i sems gnyis cig car 'byung ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu skar khung tha dad pa nas 'jug pa dag bzhin du rdzas tha dad pa yang ma yin te shes pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig tu zad par rigs mthun pa'i sems gnyis cig car 'byung ba yang ma yin no //
translated: they are not different substances, like people entering a room through different doors, because they are the same in being essentially consciousness. Two minds of the same type do not occur simultaneously.

original: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig tu zad kyang rang dang gzhan gyi yul rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa tha dad pa la yang dus gcig tu dmigs so //
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig tu zad kyang rang dang gzhan gyi yul rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa tha dad pa la yang dus gcig tu dmigs so //
translated: Although they are the same in being essentially consciousness, they simultaneously observe different objects, which are included in the categories of self and other, and which are apprehended by their own characteristics.

original: de ltar dus gcig tu dmigs kyang de'i gnas skabs na grogs kun du 'gro ba lnga dang mtshungs par ldan par zad kyi yul bye brag tu mi gcod pas sems las byung ba dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa rang gi sa ba dag med pa'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems mi mthun pa gnyis dus gcig @82a * //üîΩtu 'byung ba yang med do //üîΩde ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i gnas dbang po gzugs can nges pa med la dmigs pa rang gi mtshan nyid yin par 'dra bas rang dang gzhan gyi gnas dmigs pa thams cad du 'gro ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar dus gcig tu dmigs kyang de'i gnas skabs na grogs kun du 'gro ba lnga dang mtshungs par ldan par zad kyi yul bye brag tu mi gcod pas sems las byung ba dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa rang gi sa ba dag med pa'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems mi mthun pa gnyis dus gcig @82a * // tu 'byung ba yang med do // de ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i gnas dbang po gzugs can nges pa med la dmigs pa rang gi mtshan nyid yin par 'dra bas rang dang gzhan gyi gnas dmigs pa thams cad du 'gro ba yin gyi /
translated: They are not concomitant because they are not similar in terms of their basis, support, object field, and aspect.üîΩThey are not concomitant because they are not similar in terms of their basis, support, object field, and aspect.üîΩThey are not concomitant because they are not similar in terms of their basis, support, object field, and aspect.üîΩThey are not concomitant because they are not similar in terms of their basis, support, object field, and aspect.

analyzed: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa dag ni gnas pa dang dmigs pa so sor nges pa'i phyir thams cad du 'gro ba ma yin no //
translated: They are not concomitant because they are not similar in terms of their basis, support, object field, and aspect.üîΩThey are not concomitant because they are not similar in terms of their basis, support, object field, and aspect.üîΩThey are not concomitant because they are not similar in terms of their basis, support, object field, and aspect.üîΩThey are not concomitant because they are not similar in terms of their basis, support, object field, and aspect.üîΩThey are not concomitant because they are not similar in terms of their basis, support, object field, and aspect.üîΩThey are not concomitant because they are not similar in terms of their basis, support, object field, and aspect.üîΩThey are not concomitant because they are not similar in terms of their basis, support, object field, and aspect.üîΩThey are not concomitant because they are not similar in terms of their basis, support, object field, and aspect.üîΩThey are not concomitant because they are not similar in terms of their basis, support, object field, and aspect.üîΩThey are not concomitant because they are not similar in terms of their basis, support, object field, and aspect.

original: de la mdor bsdu na yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni rang dang gzhan gyi yul dang / rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: de la mdor bsdu na yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni rang dang gzhan gyi yul dang / rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: In brief, the object of mental consciousness is the object of self and other and the general and specific characteristics of phenomena.

original: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni rang gi yul dang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yin no ;üîΩ/ bye brag tu dbye na nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa thams cad ni rang dang gzhan gyi yul yin mod kyi /
analyzed: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni rang gi yul dang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yin no ; / bye brag tu dbye na nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa thams cad ni rang dang gzhan gyi yul yin mod kyi /
translated: The object of the five sense consciousnesses is only the object of self and its specific characteristics.üîΩWhen classified, the object of mental consciousness that arises from the actual basis is the object of self and other.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi yul thams cad ni nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang dmigs pa ma yin te rang dang gzhan gyi yul gyi spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi yul thams cad ni nye bar gnas pa las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang dmigs pa ma yin te rang dang gzhan gyi yul gyi spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: However, not all objects of self and other are the object of mental consciousness that arises from the actual basis, because the general characteristics of the objects of self and other are not.

original: tshol ba pa dang nyes pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa thams cad dang rang dang gzhan gyi yul yin mod kyi /
analyzed: tshol ba pa dang nyes pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa thams cad dang rang dang gzhan gyi yul yin mod kyi /
translated: The object of mental consciousness that is investigation and that which is fault is the object of self and other.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi skul thams cad ni de gnyis kyi dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi skul thams cad ni de gnyis kyi dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The bodies of self and others are not the objects of those two.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi yul gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi yul gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: They are the characteristics of the objects of self and others.

original: de bzhin du sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi dmigs pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi dmigs pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin mod kyi /
translated: Similarly, the objects of all five sense consciousnesses are their own characteristics.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid thams cad ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid thams cad ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: However, not all characteristics are the objects of the five sense consciousnesses.

original: chos kyi khams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid do //üîΩde ltar rnam par shes pa rnams kyi 'jug pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan pa 'di la yang sa bon gyi gnas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang de ma thag pa'i gnas rnam par shes pa rnams 'gags ma thag pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa
analyzed: chos kyi khams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid do // de ltar rnam par shes pa rnams kyi 'jug pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan pa 'di la yang sa bon gyi gnas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang de ma thag pa'i gnas rnam par shes pa rnams 'gags ma thag pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa
translated: They are the characteristics of the phenomena element.

original: thams cad kyi gnas thun mong yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyi gnas thun mong yin no //
translated: Thus, in this presentation of the classifications of the engagement of consciousness, the seed state, the foundation consciousness, and the state of immediacy, the consciousnesses that have just ceased, are the common foundation of all engaging consciousnesses.

original: de ma thag pa'i gnas de ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa rnam par gzhag pa'i skabs su ni /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i gnas de ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa rnam par gzhag pa'i skabs su ni /
translated: That state of immediacy is the foundation of the foundation consciousness.

original: drug po 'gags ma thag pa yi //
analyzed: drug po 'gags ma thag pa yi //
translated: The immediately preceding cessation of the six is

original: rnam shes gang yin de yi de'i //
analyzed: rnam shes gang yin de yi de'i //
translated: the immediately preceding condition of that consciousness.

original: zhes gsungs pas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po nyi tshe la gzhag go //üîΩkun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gzhag pa'i skabs su ni 'byung ba'i go 'byed pa'i gnas skabs su ni /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po nyi tshe la gzhag go // kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gzhag pa'i skabs su ni 'byung ba'i go 'byed pa'i gnas skabs su ni /
translated: Thus, the sixfold class of active consciousnesses is posited as the immediately preceding condition.üîΩIn the context of positing the foundation consciousness, the immediately preceding cessation of the consciousnesses is posited as the immediately preceding condition of the foundation consciousness.

original: rnam par shes @82b pa rnams 'gags ma thag pa'o zhes gsungs pas rnam par shes pa brgyad car la gzhag go //
analyzed: rnam par shes @82b pa rnams 'gags ma thag pa'o zhes gsungs pas rnam par shes pa brgyad car la gzhag go //
translated: Thus, the eight consciousnesses are posited as the immediately preceding condition.

original: gnas de ni nges pa med de /
analyzed: gnas de ni nges pa med de /
translated: The basis of the immediately preceding condition is not fixed.

original: de la re zhig skye bo rnams kyi sems yod pa'i gnas skabs na kun gzhi dang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni rgyun rtag tu 'jug pas rang gi snga ma 'gags ma thag pa rang gi rgyun phyi ma la skye ba'i de ma thag pa'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: de la re zhig skye bo rnams kyi sems yod pa'i gnas skabs na kun gzhi dang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni rgyun rtag tu 'jug pas rang gi snga ma 'gags ma thag pa rang gi rgyun phyi ma la skye ba'i de ma thag pa'i gnas yin no //
translated: In this regard, the foundation consciousness, afflicted intellect, and mental consciousness of sentient beings always operate continuously. Thus, the immediately preceding cessation of each of these is the immediately preceding condition of the subsequent moments of its own continuum.

original: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyang thams cad dus gcig tu skye ba'i gnas skabs na ni rang ka 'gags ma thag par rang rang gi de ma thag pa'i gnas yin no //üîΩlnga char dus gcig tu 'gag pa ni mjug thogs su bzhi ni mi skye gang yang rung ba gcig skye na ni lnga char ni 'gags ma thag pa ni gang yang rung ba gcig skye ba de ma thag pa'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyang thams cad dus gcig tu skye ba'i gnas skabs na ni rang ka 'gags ma thag par rang rang gi de ma thag pa'i gnas yin no // lnga char dus gcig tu 'gag pa ni mjug thogs su bzhi ni mi skye gang yang rung ba gcig skye na ni lnga char ni 'gags ma thag pa ni gang yang rung ba gcig skye ba de ma thag pa'i gnas yin no //
translated: Also, when the five sense consciousnesses arise simultaneously, the immediately preceding state is the immediately preceding condition of each of them, immediately after they have ceased.üîΩWhen all five cease simultaneously, the immediately preceding state of any one of them that arises is the immediately preceding condition of all five.üîΩWhen four have not arisen and any one of them arises, the immediately preceding state of that one that has arisen is the immediately preceding condition of all five.

original: bzhi ni ma skyes la gang yang rung ba gcig skyes pa de 'gags ma thag tu lnga char dus gcig tu skyes na yang gcig po'i 'gags ma thag pa de lnga char skye ba'i de ma thag pa'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: bzhi ni ma skyes la gang yang rung ba gcig skyes pa de 'gags ma thag tu lnga char dus gcig tu skyes na yang gcig po'i 'gags ma thag pa de lnga char skye ba'i de ma thag pa'i gnas yin no //
translated: When all five arise simultaneously, the immediately preceding state of that one that has arisen is the immediately preceding condition of all five.

original: gnyid log pa dang brgyal ba sems med pa'i gnas skabs ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa re zhig 'gags te /
analyzed: gnyid log pa dang brgyal ba sems med pa'i gnas skabs ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa re zhig 'gags te /
translated: When the mind is unconscious, such as when one is asleep or in a faint, the five sense consciousnesses are temporarily suspended.

original: rgyun chad pa phyis skye ba ni kun gzhi dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa rgyun ma chad pa rnams kyi de ma thag pa'i gnas las skyes so //
analyzed: rgyun chad pa phyis skye ba ni kun gzhi dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa rgyun ma chad pa rnams kyi de ma thag pa'i gnas las skyes so //
translated: The later arising of the interrupted mind is born from the immediately antecedent state of the uninterrupted continuum of the foundation consciousness and afflicted mind.

original: de bzhin du 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang 'du shes med pa pa sems med pa'i gnas skabs na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po re zhig 'gags te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang 'du shes med pa pa sems med pa'i gnas skabs na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po re zhig 'gags te /
translated: Similarly, when the six active consciousnesses are temporarily stopped in the mindless states of the meditative attainment of nondiscernment and the meditative attainment of cessation,

original: rgyun chad pa byis skye ba ni kun gzhi dang nyon mongs pa can gyi rgyun ma chad pa'i de ma thag pa'i gnas las skyes so //
analyzed: rgyun chad pa byis skye ba ni kun gzhi dang nyon mongs pa can gyi rgyun ma chad pa'i de ma thag pa'i gnas las skyes so //
translated: the later arising of the interrupted mind is born from the immediately antecedent state of the uninterrupted continuum of the foundation consciousness and the afflicted mind.

original: de bzhin du 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa sems med pa'i gnas skabs na nyon mongs ba can gyi yid la sogs pa bdun po re zhig 'gags te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa sems med pa'i gnas skabs na nyon mongs ba can gyi yid la sogs pa bdun po re zhig 'gags te /
translated: Similarly, when the seven consciousnesses, such as the afflicted mind, are temporarily stopped in the mindless state of the meditative attainment of cessation,

original: rgyun chad pa phyis skye ba ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes ba rgyun ma chad pa'i de ma thag pa'i gnas skabs las skye'o //
analyzed: rgyun chad pa phyis skye ba ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes ba rgyun ma chad pa'i de ma thag pa'i gnas skabs las skye'o //
translated: the later arising of the interrupted mind is born from the immediately antecedent state of the uninterrupted continuum of the foundation consciousness.

original: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa sems med pa'i gnas skabs na ni kun gzhi spangs pas rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi de ma thag pa'i gnas med de gnas gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid ni rgyun chad ba med bar rig par bya'oüîΩ// de la gang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang @83a * //üîΩldan pa de 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang yang ldan la /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa sems med pa'i gnas skabs na ni kun gzhi spangs pas rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi de ma thag pa'i gnas med de gnas gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid ni rgyun chad ba med bar rig par bya'o // de la gang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang @83a * // ldan pa de 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang yang ldan la /
translated: The nature of the transformation should be understood as not being interrupted.üîΩIn this regard, does one who possesses foundation consciousness also possess the active consciousnesses?

original: gang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa de yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa de yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Or does one who possesses the active consciousnesses also possess foundation consciousness?

original: mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: mu bzhi ste /
translated: There are four possibilities.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang ldan la /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang ldan la /
translated: One possesses foundation consciousness but not the active consciousnesses.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mi ldan pa ni gnyid log pa'i sems med pa dang / brgyal ba sems med pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs ba la snyoms par zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mi ldan pa ni gnyid log pa'i sems med pa dang / brgyal ba sems med pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs ba la snyoms par zhugs pa dang /
translated: Those who are not endowed with the active consciousness are those who are asleep and have no mind, those who are unconscious, those who have entered the meditative attainment of nondiscernment, those who have entered the meditative attainment of cessation,

original: 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams kyi nang du skyes pa de ci rigs par sbyar ro //üîΩ'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang ldan la /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams kyi nang du skyes pa de ci rigs par sbyar ro // 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang ldan la /
translated: and those who have been born among the beings of the formless realm, the beings of the meditative attainment of nondiscernment, and the beings of the peak of existence.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang mi ldan pa ni sems yod pa'i gnas skabs na dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang mi ldan pa ni sems yod pa'i gnas skabs na dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: Those who are endowed with the active consciousness but not with the consciousness that is the foundation of all are those who have a mind, such as arhats, pratyekabuddhas, irreversible bodhisattvas, and tathƒÅgatas.

original: gnyis ka dang ldan pa ni sems yod pa'i gnas skabs na de dag las gzhan pa rnams so //
analyzed: gnyis ka dang ldan pa ni sems yod pa'i gnas skabs na de dag las gzhan pa rnams so //
translated: Those who are endowed with both are those who have a mind, but are other than those.

original: gnyis ka dang mi ldan pa ni dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings na'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka dang mi ldan pa ni dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings na'o //
translated: Those not possessing either are the arhat, pratyekabuddha, irreversible bodhisattva, tathagata, one who has entered the absorption of cessation, and the basic element of nirvana without remainder.

original: rnam par shes pa lhan cig 'byung ba'i tshul bshad pa'i skabs 'di la nyan thos kyi sde pa kha cig sems rigs mi mthun pa gnyis kyang lhan cig 'byung ba med par 'dod pa de dag ni byis pa'i shes rab can dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba yinüîΩpas de dag gi rjes su 'jug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lhan cig 'byung ba'i tshul bshad pa'i skabs 'di la nyan thos kyi sde pa kha cig sems rigs mi mthun pa gnyis kyang lhan cig 'byung ba med par 'dod pa de dag ni byis pa'i shes rab can dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba yin pas de dag gi rjes su 'jug par mi bya'o //
translated: In this context of explaining the mode of simultaneous occurrence of consciousness, some ≈õrƒÅvaka schools assert that two dissimilar types of minds do not occur simultaneously. They are of childish understanding, and they follow faith.

original: de bas na rnam par shes pa rigs mthun pa ni gnyis cig car mi 'byung gi rigs mi mthun pa ni rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du gcig nas gnyis rab tu mang po yang lhan cig 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bas na rnam par shes pa rigs mthun pa ni gnyis cig car mi 'byung gi rigs mi mthun pa ni rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du gcig nas gnyis rab tu mang po yang lhan cig 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, two similar types of consciousness do not occur simultaneously, but dissimilar types occur simultaneously, from one up to many, in accordance with conditions.

original: rnal 'byor pa dag gi sems ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa gcig gis kyang gzhan thams cad kyi bya ba byed nus pas rnam par shes pa'i 'jug pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa dag gi sems ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa gcig gis kyang gzhan thams cad kyi bya ba byed nus pas rnam par shes pa'i 'jug pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab par rig par bya'o //
translated: The minds of yogis are such that even a single consciousness of the five sense doors can perform the function of all the others. Therefore, one should understand that the engagement of consciousness is inconceivable.

original: blo gros yangs pa 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dpe rnam pa gnyis kyis ni sa bon gyi gnas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la brten nas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du 'byung ba'i @83b don
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dpe rnam pa gnyis kyis ni sa bon gyi gnas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la brten nas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du 'byung ba'i @83b don
translated: The two examples beginning with ‚ÄúAnantavy≈´ha, it is like this‚Ä¶‚Äù teach the meaning of the engagement of consciousness in dependence on the consciousness of the ground of all, which is the abode of seeds, arising in accordance with conditions.

original: sngar bstan pa de nyid kyi dpe ston to //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa de nyid kyi dpe ston to //
translated: They teach the same meaning that was previously presented.

original: de yang chu'i klung chen po 'bab pa zhes bya ba dang / me long gi dkyil 'khor yongs su dag pa'i zhes bya ba'i gnas lta bu ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de yang chu'i klung chen po 'bab pa zhes bya ba dang / me long gi dkyil 'khor yongs su dag pa'i zhes bya ba'i gnas lta bu ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The abode of a great river flowing and the abode of a completely pure mirror-like surface are like the consciousness of the ground of all.

original: rlabs dang gzugs brnyan gyi gnas lta bu ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams so ;
analyzed: rlabs dang gzugs brnyan gyi gnas lta bu ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams so ;
translated: The abodes of waves and reflections are like the engaged consciousnesses.

original: /'byung ba'i rkyen ces bya ba ni rlung dang gzugs kyi dngos po la sogs pa dag ste /
analyzed: /'byung ba'i rkyen ces bya ba ni rlung dang gzugs kyi dngos po la sogs pa dag ste /
translated: The ‚Äúconditions of arising‚Äù are wind, form, and so on.

original: rkyen de dag gi gnas lta bu ni de ma thag pa'i gnas 'gags ma thag pa dang / lhan cig pa'i gnas dbang po gzugs can dang / dmigs pa yul dang de dang 'byung ba yid la byed pa la sogs pa rnams yin par blta'o //
analyzed: rkyen de dag gi gnas lta bu ni de ma thag pa'i gnas 'gags ma thag pa dang / lhan cig pa'i gnas dbang po gzugs can dang / dmigs pa yul dang de dang 'byung ba yid la byed pa la sogs pa rnams yin par blta'o //
translated: The ‚Äúbasis of those conditions‚Äù should be understood as the immediately preceding basis, the immediately preceding cessation, the simultaneous basis, the physical sense faculties, the objective referent, and the mental attention that occurs in conjunction with that.

original: 'o na dpe'i dngos po gcig bstan pas chog na rnam pa gnyis smras pa la dgos pa lhag pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na dpe'i dngos po gcig bstan pas chog na rnam pa gnyis smras pa la dgos pa lhag pa ci yod ce na /
translated: If it is sufficient to teach a single example, what is the additional purpose of teaching two types?

original: don gyi gnas mtshon pa la ni dpe gcig dang chog mod kyi /
analyzed: don gyi gnas mtshon pa la ni dpe gcig dang chog mod kyi /
translated: It is sufficient to teach a single example in order to illustrate the meaning of the term.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul gzhan dag log par mngon par zhen pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul gzhan dag log par mngon par zhen pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: However, there are two types of erroneous convictions regarding the mode of dependent origination.

original: rgyu'i rgyun snga ma zad nas 'bras bu phyi ma rgyu med pa las 'byung ba lta bu dang rgyu nyid 'bras bu'i gnas su 'pho bar blta ba bsal ba'i phyir dpe rnam pa gnyis su gsungs te go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i rgyun snga ma zad nas 'bras bu phyi ma rgyu med pa las 'byung ba lta bu dang rgyu nyid 'bras bu'i gnas su 'pho bar blta ba bsal ba'i phyir dpe rnam pa gnyis su gsungs te go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: Two examples are taught in order to eliminate the view that the prior continuum of causes is exhausted and the subsequent effect arises without a cause, and the view that the cause itself moves to the place of the effect.

original: de la chu'i klung de rang gi rgyun gyis rgyun chad par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la chu'i klung de rang gi rgyun gyis rgyun chad par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: The river of water does not cease due to its own continuum.

original: yongs su zad par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i rgyun snga ma zad nas 'bras bu phyi ma rgyu med pa las 'byung bar lta ba sel to //
analyzed: yongs su zad par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i rgyun snga ma zad nas 'bras bu phyi ma rgyu med pa las 'byung bar lta ba sel to //
translated: Nor does it completely come to an end. This eliminates the view that the prior continuum of causes is exhausted and the subsequent effect arises without a cause.

original: de ltar lta ba su zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar lta ba su zhe na /
translated: Who views it in this way?

original: 'di ltar 'di ni dge sbyong bram ze rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su rgyu med par smra ba dag las kha cig ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni dge sbyong bram ze rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su rgyu med par smra ba dag las kha cig ste /
translated: Some of those ascetics and brahmins who are eternalists, who proclaim the world to be permanent, and who proclaim the world to be eternal, proclaim the world to be without a cause.

original: de dag kyang ci'i phyir de ltar lta zhing rnam par 'jog pa la yongs su ston par byed ce na /
analyzed: de dag kyang ci'i phyir de ltar lta zhing rnam par 'jog pa la yongs su ston par byed ce na /
translated: Why do they view and posit it in this way?

original: 'di ltar lung dang rigs pas byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar lung dang rigs pas byed de /
translated: This is so because of scripture and logic.

original: lung gang zhe na rgyu med pa kho na'o zhes de dang ldan pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dang / sde snod byin pa'i tshul gyis de dag la 'ongs pa yin no //
analyzed: lung gang zhe na rgyu med pa kho na'o zhes de dang ldan pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dang / sde snod byin pa'i tshul gyis de dag la 'ongs pa yin no //
translated: What is scripture? It is the transmission from one to another that the world has no cause, and that it has come to them in the manner of a transmission of a canon.

original: rigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is logic?

original: 'di ltar dge slong dang bram ze rtog ge pa spyod pa can rtog ger gtogs pa'i rang gi spobs pa las byung ba'i so so'i skye bo sa dpyod pa'i rjes su dpyod pa la gnas pa de dag bsam gtan la brten pa dang / rtog ge la brten pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa gnyis su smra ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge slong dang bram ze rtog ge pa spyod pa can rtog ger gtogs pa'i rang gi spobs pa las byung ba'i so so'i skye bo sa dpyod pa'i rjes su dpyod pa la gnas pa de dag bsam gtan la brten pa dang / rtog ge la brten pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa gnyis su smra ste /
translated: It is this: monks and brahmans who are logicians, who are engaged in speculation, who are ordinary beings who are engaged in the logic of analysis, who are engaged in analysis, they speak in two ways, based on meditative stabilization and based on logic.

original: de la bsam gtan la brten pa @84a * //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan la brten pa @84a * //
translated: Among them, those who are based on meditative stabilization

original: ni dge sbyong dang bram zi sngon gyi mthar rtog pa kha cig 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan chung du dang 'bring dang chen po la brten nas sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pas sems can dang / 'jig rten gyi sngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa na tshe rabs gcig gam gnyis sam mang po zhig gam bar gyi bskal pa gcig gam gnyis sam mang po zhig gam /
analyzed: ni dge sbyong dang bram zi sngon gyi mthar rtog pa kha cig 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan chung du dang 'bring dang chen po la brten nas sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pas sems can dang / 'jig rten gyi sngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa na tshe rabs gcig gam gnyis sam mang po zhig gam bar gyi bskal pa gcig gam gnyis sam mang po zhig gam /
translated: Some ascetics and brahmins, through the power of their concentration, recollect their previous abodes.üîΩThey think that sentient beings and the world have no cause or basis.

original: bskal pa chen po gcig tshun chad rjes su dran pa na de dag gi sngon rol gyi rgyu'i rgyun 'brel ba rjes su ma mthong bas 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: bskal pa chen po gcig tshun chad rjes su dran pa na de dag gi sngon rol gyi rgyu'i rgyun 'brel ba rjes su ma mthong bas 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Some ascetics and brahmins, through the power of their concentration, recollect their previous abodes.üîΩThey think that sentient beings and the world have no cause or basis.üîΩSome ascetics and brahmins, through the power of their concentration, recollect their previous abodes.üîΩThey think that sentient beings and the world have no cause or basis.üîΩSome ascetics and brahmins, through the power of their concentration, recollect their previous abodes.

original: sems can dang 'jig rten 'di dag dang por grub pa'i rgyu'i snga ma ni rgyun chad de med pa yin pas des ni ma bskyed kyi 'bras bu phyi ma 'di dag ni rgyu med pa las byung ba yin no snyam du sems pa ste /
analyzed: sems can dang 'jig rten 'di dag dang por grub pa'i rgyu'i snga ma ni rgyun chad de med pa yin pas des ni ma bskyed kyi 'bras bu phyi ma 'di dag ni rgyu med pa las byung ba yin no snyam du sems pa ste /
translated: They think that sentient beings and the world have no cause or basis.üîΩSome ascetics and brahmins, through the power of their concentration, recollect their previous abodes.üîΩThey think that sentient beings and the world have no cause or basis.

original: de dag la yang lta bar gyur pa 'di 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag la yang lta bar gyur pa 'di 'byung ngo //
translated: And they also have this view.

original: rtog ge brten pa ni mdor bsdu na de dag gis nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po 'di dag sus kyang bsam pa sngon du ma btang bar rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba dang / res 'ga' rgyu rnams 'bras bu med par snang ba dang /
analyzed: rtog ge brten pa ni mdor bsdu na de dag gis nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po 'di dag sus kyang bsam pa sngon du ma btang bar rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba dang / res 'ga' rgyu rnams 'bras bu med par snang ba dang /
translated: In brief, those who rely on sophistry see that these internal and external things appear in various ways without anyone having premeditated it, and sometimes causes appear to be without effects.

original: res 'ga' glo bur du rlung ldang la res 'ga' mi ldang ba dang / res 'ga' glo bur du chu klung 'bab la res 'ga' mi 'bab pa dang / res 'ga' glo bur du shing ljon pa dag las me tog dang 'bras bu 'byung la /
analyzed: res 'ga' glo bur du rlung ldang la res 'ga' mi ldang ba dang / res 'ga' glo bur du chu klung 'bab la res 'ga' mi 'bab pa dang / res 'ga' glo bur du shing ljon pa dag las me tog dang 'bras bu 'byung la /
translated: Sometimes the wind blows suddenly and sometimes it does not, sometimes rivers flow suddenly and sometimes they do not, sometimes flowers and fruit suddenly appear on trees and sometimes they do not.

original: res 'ga' mi 'byung ba la sogs pa mthong ba na de dag gi sngon rol gyi rgyu'i rgyun 'brel pa rjes su ma mthong bas 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: res 'ga' mi 'byung ba la sogs pa mthong ba na de dag gi sngon rol gyi rgyu'i rgyun 'brel pa rjes su ma mthong bas 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Seeing this, they do not see a continuous causal stream prior to these events and think, ‚ÄúThese things arise without causes.‚Äù

original: phyi nang gi dngos po 'di dang po grub pa'i rgyu'i rgyun snga ma'i rgyun chad de med pa yin pas des ni ma bskyed kyi /
analyzed: phyi nang gi dngos po 'di dang po grub pa'i rgyu'i rgyun snga ma'i rgyun chad de med pa yin pas des ni ma bskyed kyi /
translated: Since the continuum of the prior cause of the establishment of outer and inner things is severed and does not exist, it does not generate them.

original: 'bras bu phyi ma 'di dag ni rgyu med pa las 'byung ba yin no snyam du sems pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu phyi ma 'di dag ni rgyu med pa las 'byung ba yin no snyam du sems pa ste /
translated: These subsequent effects arise without a cause.

original: de dag la yang lta bar gyur pa 'di 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag la yang lta bar gyur pa 'di 'byung ngo //
translated: This view arises in them.

original: de'i phyir de dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog cing rigs pas bskyed pa ma yin pa'i smras pa mang du brjod pas de bsal ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis dpe bstan pa'i skabs 'dir de skad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog cing rigs pas bskyed pa ma yin pa'i smras pa mang du brjod pas de bsal ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis dpe bstan pa'i skabs 'dir de skad ces gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, since they think about dependent origination incorrectly and speak much about what is not generated by reasoning, the Bhagavat taught this in this section on the teaching of examples in order to eliminate that.

original: 'dir rigs pa brjod pa ni rtog ge pa bsam gtan pa'i tshul gyis smra ba de dag ni 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir rigs pa brjod pa ni rtog ge pa bsam gtan pa'i tshul gyis smra ba de dag ni 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here, the logicians who speak in the manner of contemplatives should be addressed as follows.

original: ci sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa de dngos po med pa zhig rjes su dran nam 'on te sems can dang 'jig rten rjes su dran par 'dod /
analyzed: ci sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa de dngos po med pa zhig rjes su dran nam 'on te sems can dang 'jig rten rjes su dran par 'dod /
translated: Is it that the recollection of past lives recollects a non-thing, or is it asserted that it recollects sentient beings and the world?

original: gal te dngos @84b po med pa rjes su dran zhes byar ni dngos po med na sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran zhes byar yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te dngos @84b po med pa rjes su dran zhes byar ni dngos po med na sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran zhes byar yang mi rung ngo //
translated: If it is said that it recollects a non-thing, then it is not tenable to say that it recollects past lives.

original: gal te sems can dang 'jig rten rjes su dran na ni des na 'bras bu 'di dag rgyu med pa las byung zhes byar yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te sems can dang 'jig rten rjes su dran na ni des na 'bras bu 'di dag rgyu med pa las byung zhes byar yang mi rung ngo //
translated: If it recollects sentient beings and the world, then it is not tenable to say that these effects arise without a cause.

original: rtog ge pa rtog ge pa la brten pa'i tshul gyis smra ba de dag la ni 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rtog ge pa rtog ge pa la brten pa'i tshul gyis smra ba de dag la ni 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: To those who speak in this way, relying on the logic of logicians, one should say:

original: ci'i phyir nang gi dngos po rnam pa sna tshogs su 'jug pa dang / glo bur du 'jug par snang ba de rgyu med pa'am /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nang gi dngos po rnam pa sna tshogs su 'jug pa dang / glo bur du 'jug par snang ba de rgyu med pa'am /
translated: Why do you assert that the various internal things arise in different ways and appear to arise suddenly, either without a cause or

original: 'on te rgyu yod par 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu yod par 'dod /
translated: with a cause?

original: gal te rgyu med ces byar ni rgyu med na rnam pa sna chogs su 'jug pa dang / glo bur du 'jug par snang zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te rgyu med ces byar ni rgyu med na rnam pa sna chogs su 'jug pa dang / glo bur du 'jug par snang zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: If it is said that it is causeless, then it is not possible to say that it engages in various ways or that it engages suddenly, if it has no cause.

original: gal te rgyu yod na ni des na 'bras bu 'di dag rgyu med pa las byung zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te rgyu yod na ni des na 'bras bu 'di dag rgyu med pa las byung zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: If it has a cause, then it is not possible to say that these effects arise without a cause.

original: de ltar na dngos po med pa rjes su dran pa dang / sems can dang 'jig rten rjes su dran pa dang rgyu med par 'jug pa dang rgyu yod par 'jug pas kyang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po med pa rjes su dran pa dang / sems can dang 'jig rten rjes su dran pa dang rgyu med par 'jug pa dang rgyu yod par 'jug pas kyang mi rung ste /
translated: Thus, it is not possible to remember a non-existent thing, or to remember sentient beings and the world, or to engage in the absence of a cause, or to engage in the presence of a cause.

original: de bas na smra ba de ni rigs pas bskyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na smra ba de ni rigs pas bskyed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this statement is not generated by reasoning.

original: de'i phyir chos thams cad ni rgyu dang rkyen la brten te 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos thams cad ni rgyu dang rkyen la brten te 'byung ba yin la /
translated: Thus, all things arise in dependence on causes and conditions.

original: rgyu'i rgyun snga ma zad nas 'bras bu phyi ma rgyu med ba las byung ba ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i rgyun snga ma zad nas 'bras bu phyi ma rgyu med ba las byung ba ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the prior continuum of causes is not exhausted, and that subsequent effects do not arise without a cause.

original: me long gi dkyil 'khor dang gzugs brnyan gyi dngos por yongs su gyur ba yang ma yin la yongs su spro bar yang mi mngon pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu nyid 'bras bu'i gnas su 'pho bar lta ba sel to //
analyzed: me long gi dkyil 'khor dang gzugs brnyan gyi dngos por yongs su gyur ba yang ma yin la yongs su spro bar yang mi mngon pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu nyid 'bras bu'i gnas su 'pho bar lta ba sel to //
translated: It is not that the surface of the mirror and the entity of the reflection are completely transformed, nor is it that the reflection is not seen at all.

original: de ltar lta ba su zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar lta ba su zhe na /
translated: Who holds this view?

original: 'di ltar 'di ni dge sbyong dang bram ze kha cig dang / chos 'di la kha cig 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa rjes su yod bar smra ba dag ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni dge sbyong dang bram ze kha cig dang / chos 'di la kha cig 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa rjes su yod bar smra ba dag ste /
translated: Some ascetics and brahmins, and some in this Dharma who maintain that the past and future exist.

original: de dag kyang ci'i phyir de ltar lta zhing rnam par 'jog pa la yongs su ston par byed ce na 'di ltar lung dang rigs pas byed de /
analyzed: de dag kyang ci'i phyir de ltar lta zhing rnam par 'jog pa la yongs su ston par byed ce na 'di ltar lung dang rigs pas byed de /
translated: Why do they hold and posit this view and teach it? They do so through scripture and reasoning.

original: de la rtog ge dag gi lung ni snga ma bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la rtog ge dag gi lung ni snga ma bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Regarding that, the scripture of the logicians should be seen as before.

original: chos 'di pa dag gi lung gi mdo sde la tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: chos 'di pa dag gi lung gi mdo sde la tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog pa ste /
translated: The scripture of those in this Dharma is the s≈´tras that are improperly contemplated.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis skye mched bcu gnyis po thams cad mtshan nyid kyis yod do zhes gsungs pa dang / 'das pa'i las yod do zhes gsungs pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i 'du byed dang / khams yod do zhes gsungs pa la tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog pa'o //üîΩrigs pa gang zhe na rtog ge pa can rtog ger gtogs pa'i sa rang @85a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis skye mched bcu gnyis po thams cad mtshan nyid kyis yod do zhes gsungs pa dang / 'das pa'i las yod do zhes gsungs pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i 'du byed dang / khams yod do zhes gsungs pa la tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog pa'o // rigs pa gang zhe na rtog ge pa can rtog ger gtogs pa'i sa rang @85a * //
translated: The Lord has said that all twelve bases exist by way of their own character, that past karma exists, that past, future, and present formations and elements exist.

original: gi spobs pa las byung ba'i so so'i skye bos dpyod pa'i rjes su dpyod pa la gnas pa de dag dang / chos 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab thog ma dang bar dang tha mar dge ba /
analyzed: gi spobs pa las byung ba'i so so'i skye bos dpyod pa'i rjes su dpyod pa la gnas pa de dag dang / chos 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab thog ma dang bar dang tha mar dge ba /
translated: What is reasoning? It is the analysis of those who are not properly oriented to the scriptures of the Tathagata, who are logicians belonging to the level of logicians, who are ordinary beings who analyze in accordance with what arises from their own intellectual prowess, and who are logicians who are attached to the logicians' level.

original: gser bzang po lta bur bsreg pa dang bcad pa dang bdar ba dang 'dra ba'i mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang / lung gi tshig rnams kyis shin tu rnam par dag pa la mig bkab ste lag nom byed pa dang 'dra ba de dag gi lugs mthun te /
analyzed: gser bzang po lta bur bsreg pa dang bcad pa dang bdar ba dang 'dra ba'i mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang / lung gi tshig rnams kyis shin tu rnam par dag pa la mig bkab ste lag nom byed pa dang 'dra ba de dag gi lugs mthun te /
translated: Like gold that is burned, cut, and rubbed, the pure is well established by direct perception, inference, and the words of the scriptures.

original: de dag 'di snyam du sems te chos gang rang gi mtshan nyid gang gis rnam par gnas pa de ni des yongs su grub pa yin te ;
analyzed: de dag 'di snyam du sems te chos gang rang gi mtshan nyid gang gis rnam par gnas pa de ni des yongs su grub pa yin te ;
translated: They think this way: ‚ÄúAny phenomenon that is established by its own characteristic is fully established by that.

original: gal te ma 'ongs pa de med du zin na ni des ni de'i tshe rang gi mtshan nyid ma zin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ma 'ongs pa de med du zin na ni des ni de'i tshe rang gi mtshan nyid ma zin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that future did not exist, then at that time it would not be established by its own characteristic.

original: gal te 'das pa med du zin na ni des na de'i tshe rang gi mtshan nyid dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'das pa med du zin na ni des na de'i tshe rang gi mtshan nyid dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the past did not exist, then at that time it would be devoid of its own characteristic.

original: de ltar gyur na rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su ma grub pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su ma grub pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas /
translated: If that were the case, there would be the fault that its own characteristic would not be fully established.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid ni yongs su ma grub ces byar mi rung ngo snyam nas des na de dag 'das pa yang yod /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid ni yongs su ma grub ces byar mi rung ngo snyam nas des na de dag 'das pa yang yod /
translated: Therefore, it is not suitable to say that intrinsic characteristics are not fully established.

original: ma 'ongs pa yang yod de /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang yod de /
translated: Thus they say, ‚ÄúThe past exists and the future exists.

original: 'das pa thams cad ni da ltar byung ba'i rgyu yin pas rgyu de nyid dang da ltar byung ba'i 'bras bu'i gnas su 'pho la /
analyzed: 'das pa thams cad ni da ltar byung ba'i rgyu yin pas rgyu de nyid dang da ltar byung ba'i 'bras bu'i gnas su 'pho la /
translated: All past states are the cause of present states, and that cause itself transforms into the state of the result that is present.üîΩAll present states are the cause of future states, and that cause itself transforms into the state of the result that is future.‚Äù

original: da ltar byung ba thams cad ni ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu yin pas rgyu de nyid ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu'i gnas su 'pho bar 'gyur ro zhes de ltar lta zhing de skad ces smra'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba thams cad ni ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu yin pas rgyu de nyid ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu'i gnas su 'pho bar 'gyur ro zhes de ltar lta zhing de skad ces smra'o //
translated: Thus they view and speak in this way.

original: de'i phyir de dag rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog cing rigs pas bskyed pa ma yin pa'i smra ba mang du brjod pas de bsal ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis dpe bstan pa'i phyir skabs 'dir de skad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog cing rigs pas bskyed pa ma yin pa'i smra ba mang du brjod pas de bsal ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis dpe bstan pa'i phyir skabs 'dir de skad ces gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, since they incorrectly conceive dependent origination and speak much about what is not generated by reasoning, the BhagavƒÅn taught this section in order to eliminate that and to teach an example.

original: 'dir rigs pa brjod pa re zhig rtog ge pa dang chos 'di ba de dag gnyis ka la spyir 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir rigs pa brjod pa re zhig rtog ge pa dang chos 'di ba de dag gnyis ka la spyir 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here, in response to the logicians and the proponents of this doctrine, we say the following in general:

original: ci 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid gcig par 'dod dam /
analyzed: ci 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid gcig par 'dod dam /
translated: Do you assert that the characteristics of the past, future, and present are the same?

original: 'on te mtshan nyid tha dad par 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te mtshan nyid tha dad par 'dod /
translated: Or do you assert that they are different?

original: gal te mtshan nyid gcig par 'dod na ni des mtshan nyid dus gsum du gzhag par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid gcig par 'dod na ni des mtshan nyid dus gsum du gzhag par mi rung ngo //
translated: If you assert that they are the same, it is not tenable to posit the characteristics in the three times.

original: gal te mtshan nyid tha dad na ni des 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rang gi mtshan nyid des yongs su grub ces byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid tha dad na ni des 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rang gi mtshan nyid des yongs su grub ces byar mi rung ngo //
translated: If you assert that they are different, it is not tenable to say that the past and future are fully established by their own characteristics.

original: de dag la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par @85b bya ste ;üîΩci dus su rtogs pa'i chos rtag pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dod dam /
analyzed: de dag la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par @85b bya ste ; ci dus su rtogs pa'i chos rtag pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dod dam /
translated: We also say the following to them:üîΩDo you assert that the phenomena that are realized in the three times are characterized by permanence?

original: 'on te mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dod /
translated: Or do you assert that they are characterized by impermanence?

original: gal te rtag pa'i mtshan nyid yin na ni des dus gsum du rtogs zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te rtag pa'i mtshan nyid yin na ni des dus gsum du rtogs zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: If it is the characteristic of the permanent, then it is not tenable to say that it is realized in the three times.

original: gal te mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid yin na ni des na dus gsum du de kho na bzhin du yod do zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid yin na ni des na dus gsum du de kho na bzhin du yod do zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: If it is the characteristic of the impermanent, then it is not tenable to say that it exists just as it is in the three times.

original: de dag la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag la 'di skad ces kyang brjod par bya ste /
translated: You should also be told the following:

original: gal te ma 'ongs pa'i chos 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid kyis yod pa kho na las da ltar gyi dus su 'byung bar 'gyur na de 'pho zhing 'byung ste /
analyzed: gal te ma 'ongs pa'i chos 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid kyis yod pa kho na las da ltar gyi dus su 'byung bar 'gyur na de 'pho zhing 'byung ste /
translated: If the future exists only through the characteristic of conditioned states, then it would arise in the present time having passed from the future.üîΩWould it arise having passed from the future to the present time, or would it arise having passed away from the future to the present time?

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi yul nas da ltar gyi dus kyi yul du 'pho zhing 'byung bar 'gyur ram 'chi 'pho zhing 'byung ste ma 'ongs pa'i dus nas shi 'phos nas da lar gyi dus su 'byung bar 'gyur ram /üîΩbrten nas 'byung ste ma 'ongs pa de kho na bzhin du mi 'gyur bar 'dug la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi yul nas da ltar gyi dus kyi yul du 'pho zhing 'byung bar 'gyur ram 'chi 'pho zhing 'byung ste ma 'ongs pa'i dus nas shi 'phos nas da lar gyi dus su 'byung bar 'gyur ram /üîΩbrten nas 'byung ste ma 'ongs pa de kho na bzhin du mi 'gyur bar 'dug la /
translated: Or would it arise in dependence, without changing from the future?

original: de la brten te gzhan kho na zhig da ltar gyi dus su 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: de la brten te gzhan kho na zhig da ltar gyi dus su 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Or does it arise in the present due to another cause?

original: las dang bcas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: las dang bcas par 'byung ste /
translated: It arises together with karma.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na las mi byed par 'gyur ba las da ltar gyi dus su las byed pa zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na las mi byed par 'gyur ba las da ltar gyi dus su las byed pa zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Or does it arise in the present due to karma that does not perform its function in the future?

original: mtshan nyid rdzogs par 'byung ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid rdzogs par 'byung ste /
translated: It arises with complete characteristics.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus mtshan nyid ma rdzogs par gyur pa las da ltar gyi dus su mtshan nyid rdzogs pa zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ram ;
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus mtshan nyid ma rdzogs par gyur pa las da ltar gyi dus su mtshan nyid rdzogs pa zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ram ;
translated: Or does it arise in the present with complete characteristics due to incomplete characteristics in the future?

original: mtshan nyid 'dra bar 'byung ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'dra bar 'byung ste /
translated: It arises with similar characteristics.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na /
translated: In the future

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po dang / 'bras bu'i dngos po de gnyis mtshan nyid mi 'dra bar gyur pa las da ltar gyi dus da ltar gyi dngos po dang 'bras bu'i dngos po de gnyis kyi mtshan nyid 'dra ba zhig 'byung bar 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po dang / 'bras bu'i dngos po de gnyis mtshan nyid mi 'dra bar gyur pa las da ltar gyi dus da ltar gyi dngos po dang 'bras bu'i dngos po de gnyis kyi mtshan nyid 'dra ba zhig 'byung bar 'gyur grang na /
translated: the two things‚Äîthe future thing and the resultant thing‚Äîarise with dissimilar characteristics in the present, and the two things‚Äîthe present thing and the resultant thing‚Äîarise with similar characteristics in the present.

original: de yong cing 'byung bar ni rnam pa drug po de dag thams cad kyis mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de yong cing 'byung bar ni rnam pa drug po de dag thams cad kyis mi rung ngo //
translated: It is impossible for it to come and arise in any of these six ways.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it impossible?

original: gal te 'byung bar gyur na des ma 'ongs pa yul na mi gnas phyogs na mi gnas pa yul na gnas mi srid pa de yul na gnas par 'gyur ba dang / ma 'ongs pa nyid nyams pas da ltar dang yang bye brag med de ther zug par 'gyur bas de ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te 'byung bar gyur na des ma 'ongs pa yul na mi gnas phyogs na mi gnas pa yul na gnas mi srid pa de yul na gnas par 'gyur ba dang / ma 'ongs pa nyid nyams pas da ltar dang yang bye brag med de ther zug par 'gyur bas de ni mi rung ngo //
translated: If it were possible, then the future would not be a non-abiding, non-located object, and it would be possible for it to abide as an object, and since the future itself would be lost, it would be no different from the present.

original: gal te 'chi 'pho zhing 'byung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'chi 'pho zhing 'byung bar 'gyur na /
translated: If it were possible for it to arise through death and transmigration,üîΩthen the future would die and be destroyed, and the future would not arise in the present.

original: yang des na ma 'ongs pa de shi 'phos te zhig par gyur pas ma 'ongs pa dngos 'dir ma skyes par 'gyur ba dang / ma 'ongs pa ni sngon ma byung ba dang ma skyes pa yin pas ma byung ba dang ma skyes pa la @86a * //
analyzed: yang des na ma 'ongs pa de shi 'phos te zhig par gyur pas ma 'ongs pa dngos 'dir ma skyes par 'gyur ba dang / ma 'ongs pa ni sngon ma byung ba dang ma skyes pa yin pas ma byung ba dang ma skyes pa la @86a * //
translated: Since the future is that which has not occurred and not arisen previously, it is impossible for that which has not occurred and not arisen to arise in the present.

original: skye ba dang 'chi 'pho mi srid pa de 'dir skyes pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus su shi 'phos par 'gyur bas de yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'chi 'pho mi srid pa de 'dir skyes pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus su shi 'phos par 'gyur bas de yang mi rung ngo //
translated: is born here or will die and transmigrate later.

original: gal te brten nas 'byung bar 'gyur na yang des na ma 'ongs pa de de kho na bzhin du mi 'gyur bar 'dug pas ther zug par 'gyur ba dang / de la brten pa de yang sngon ma byung ba yin pas ma byung ba la skye ba mi srid pas de 'dir skyes par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: gal te brten nas 'byung bar 'gyur na yang des na ma 'ongs pa de de kho na bzhin du mi 'gyur bar 'dug pas ther zug par 'gyur ba dang / de la brten pa de yang sngon ma byung ba yin pas ma byung ba la skye ba mi srid pas de 'dir skyes par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: If it were to arise in dependence, then since that future would not exist as it is, it would be permanent. Since that which is dependent on it did not occur previously, since it is impossible for the non-arisen to arise, it would be born here.

original: de la brten te gzhan kho na zhig 'dir skyes pas ma 'ongs pa dang / dngos 'dir ma skyes pa'i phyir de yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de la brten te gzhan kho na zhig 'dir skyes pas ma 'ongs pa dang / dngos 'dir ma skyes pa'i phyir de yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Since another would be born here in dependence on it, it is not tenable that the future and this entity are not born here.

original: gal te las dang bcas par 'byung bar 'gyur na yang des ma 'ongs pa'i dus na las mi byed par 'gyur ba las da ltar gyi dus su las byed par gyur pas las de yang sngon ma byung ba yin pas ma byung ba la skye ba mi srid
analyzed: gal te las dang bcas par 'byung bar 'gyur na yang des ma 'ongs pa'i dus na las mi byed par 'gyur ba las da ltar gyi dus su las byed par gyur pas las de yang sngon ma byung ba yin pas ma byung ba la skye ba mi srid
translated: If it were to arise with karma, then it would not perform karma in the future, but since it performs karma in the present, that karma would not have arisen previously.üîΩIt is impossible for that which has not arisen to arise in the present, and that which has arisen in the present would not arise in the future.üîΩIf karma arises here, it would not arise in the future here.

original: pa de da ltar skyes par gyur pa dang / las shig 'dir skyes pas ma 'ongs pa dngos 'dir ma skyes pa dang / ci las de yang ma 'ongs pa'i chos de dang mtshan nyid gcig gam /
analyzed: pa de da ltar skyes par gyur pa dang / las shig 'dir skyes pas ma 'ongs pa dngos 'dir ma skyes pa dang / ci las de yang ma 'ongs pa'i chos de dang mtshan nyid gcig gam /
translated: Would that karma be the same characteristic as that future phenomenon?

original: 'on te mtshan nyid tha dad par 'dod gal te mtshan nyid gcig na ni de ma 'ongs pa'i dus na las mi byed par gyur pa las da ltar gyi dus su las byed pa zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes byar yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'on te mtshan nyid tha dad par 'dod gal te mtshan nyid gcig na ni de ma 'ongs pa'i dus na las mi byed par gyur pa las da ltar gyi dus su las byed pa zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes byar yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Or is it asserted to be a different characteristic? If it is the same characteristic, then it would not be tenable to say that it arises from that which does not perform karma in the future to that which performs karma in the present.

original: gal te mtshan nyid tha dad na ni des na las de la ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa 'dir ma byung bas de yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid tha dad na ni des na las de la ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa 'dir ma byung bas de yang mi rung ngo //
translated: If they are different characteristics, then since that action would not have the characteristic of the future, it would not be future because it would not have arisen.üîΩIf the characteristics are complete, then since the future would not have incomplete characteristics, the arising of complete characteristics in the present would be illogical.

original: gal te mtshan nyid rdzogs par 'byung bar 'gyur na yang des ma 'ongs pa'i dus na mtshan nyid ma rdzogs par gyur pa las da ltar gyi dus su mtshan nyid rdzogs par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid de yang ci ma 'ongs pa'i chos de dang mtshan nyid gcig gamüîΩ/ 'on te mtshan nyid tha dad par 'dod /
analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid rdzogs par 'byung bar 'gyur na yang des ma 'ongs pa'i dus na mtshan nyid ma rdzogs par gyur pa las da ltar gyi dus su mtshan nyid rdzogs par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid de yang ci ma 'ongs pa'i chos de dang mtshan nyid gcig gam / 'on te mtshan nyid tha dad par 'dod /
translated: Moreover, if the characteristics of future phenomena are complete, are they the same as future phenomena or are they different characteristics?

original: gal te mtshan nyid gcig na ni des ma 'ongs pa de nyid da ltar byung ba yin pas ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba gnyis rang bzhin 'dres par gyur pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid gcig na ni des ma 'ongs pa de nyid da ltar byung ba yin pas ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba gnyis rang bzhin 'dres par gyur pas mi rung ngo //
translated: If they are the same, then since that future itself would be present, it would be illogical for the natures of the future and present to be mixed.

original: gal te mtshan nyid tha dad na des na ma 'ongs pa'i dus na mtshan nyid ma rdzogs pa de da ltar gyi dus su mtshan nyid rdzogs par 'gyur zhes byar yang mi rung bas de yang mi rung ngo //üîΩgal te mtshan nyid 'dra bar 'byung bar 'gyur na yang des na ma 'ongs pa'i dus na /
analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid tha dad na des na ma 'ongs pa'i dus na mtshan nyid ma rdzogs pa de da ltar gyi dus su mtshan nyid rdzogs par 'gyur zhes byar yang mi rung bas de yang mi rung ngo // gal te mtshan nyid 'dra bar 'byung bar 'gyur na yang des na ma 'ongs pa'i dus na /
translated: If they have different characteristics, then it is not tenable to say that the incomplete characteristics in the future time become the complete characteristics in the present time.üîΩIf they arise with similar characteristics, then the characteristics of those two things‚Äîthe future thing and the resultant thing‚Äîwould not be different in the future time.üîΩBut the characteristics of those two things‚Äîthe present thing and the resultant thing‚Äîwould arise with similar characteristics in the present time.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po dang / 'bras bu'i dngos po de gnyis @86b kyi mtshan nyid mi 'dra bar gyur pa las da ltar gyi dus su da ltar gyi dngos po dang 'bras bu'i dngos po de gnyis kyi mtshan nyid 'dra bar 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid de yang ci ma 'ongs pa'i chosüîΩde dang mtshan nyid gcig gam /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po dang / 'bras bu'i dngos po de gnyis @86b kyi mtshan nyid mi 'dra bar gyur pa las da ltar gyi dus su da ltar gyi dngos po dang 'bras bu'i dngos po de gnyis kyi mtshan nyid 'dra bar 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid de yang ci ma 'ongs pa'i chos de dang mtshan nyid gcig gam /
translated: But what are the characteristics of those two things‚Äîthe future thing and the resultant thing‚Äîthat arise with similar characteristics in the present time?üîΩAre they the same as the characteristics of the future thing?

original: 'on te mtshan nyid tha dad par 'dod /

original: de'i yod pa nyid dang / dmigs pas 'jug pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pas 'jug pa dang / gcig gi rkyen nyid gcig yin pas 'jug pa dang / lhan cig gi dngos po 'jug pa dag gis 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa gang yin bde dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi rab tu dbye ba yin pas kun rdzob kyi rab tu dbye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i yod pa nyid dang / dmigs pas 'jug pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pas 'jug pa dang / gcig gi rkyen nyid gcig yin pas 'jug pa dang / lhan cig gi dngos po 'jug pa dag gis 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa gang yin bde dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi rab tu dbye ba yin pas kun rdzob kyi rab tu dbye ba zhes bya'o //

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
